title: 问答在线  /  申请材料准备环节_南京大学国际合作与交流处 学生交流科
text:
Q:关于项目网申系统问题
A:部分项目的学校网申的网址可能需要Google的浏览器才能打开，需要学生自行想办法下载浏览器解决问题。

Q:关于项目申请表上的资料更改
A:交换项目申请在院系审核以后，如申请学生有资料（例如：联络电话，紧急联系人等等）变动，可联系教务处进行修改。

Q:关于语言成绩准备
A: 在申请交换项目时必须提供在有效期内的托福或雅思成绩，报名时如学校没有硬性要求规定哪种语言证明，可用相同等级的代替。（例：英语六级大约等于雅思6分）

Q:英语语言成绩（欧洲标准英语B2）是什么级别？请问可以用雅思或者托福成绩吗？
A:可以用雅思或托福成绩代替。英语B2水平相当于雅思平均分5.5， 托福 听17，读18，说20，写17。
具体可见如下的成绩换算表格：
 

 

 

 
 

Q:申请材料中国际处学生科邮寄地址如何填写？
A:可以填写国际处的地址：
DOU-JI-ZHA Building,
Section of Student Exchange Programmes, 
Office of International Cooperation and Exchanges,
Nanjing University,
22 Hankou Road,
Gulou District,
Nanjing,
CHINA
Postcode: 210093
Tel: +86-25-83592240/89683371
Fax：+86-25-83307680 
 

Q:申请交换项目时，对方学校注册表上要求填写护照信息，但是我还没有办理护照。如果我想申请加急护照的办理的话是不是要去国际处开具证明呢？
A:暂时可以如实填写护照正在办理中。不过你要加紧去办护照了。

Q:Learning agreement是指的同意书吗？如何签字？
A:Learning agreement在对方的网页上可以下载到，是一个类似于选课单的表格。建议在电脑上完成填写，之后打印出来至国际处签字，再发送扫描件至国际处学生科。地点：扬州楼822办公室，时间：上午9：00-12：00，下午2:00-5:00. 
 

Q:申请准备材料中要求两张护照照片，但办的护照中没有留下照片，办护照的地方也没有存留的底板，如何处理？
A:照片你就提交护照尺寸照片的即可，不一定要和护照照片一样的。

Q:对方大学要求的nomination form需要自己准备吗？要求提交的照片必须与护照照片一样吗？
A:Nomination form 不需要准备，由国际处填写。照片不需要跟护照照片一样，但需要同样规格的，白底两寸彩色照片。
 

Q:资产证明如何办理？
A:财产证明需要是英文的，一般银行会帮助开具中英双语的。如果存款人是家属，需要家属出具英文的financial support说明，证明愿意将这笔钱资助你用来交换。并需要家属的亲笔签名。
 

Q:某些学校的申请表上需填写一个我们学校的Email联系地址，请问应该填写什么地址呢？
A:请填写我们的公邮地址stuex@nju.edu.cn
 

Q:某些申请文件中提到申请表须由本校国际处发送到对方国际处才能生效，则申请表应该打印出来交到国际处还是发送电子版呢？
A:申请表如无特别要求，请发送电子版到我们的邮箱，由我们统一发给对方大学。请务必在申请的截止日期前将申请表发给我们。

Q:在申请交换时会要我选择志愿的顺序，然而项目的截止日期各不相同，那我的志愿的顺序的具体作用是怎么样的呢？
A:建议咨询一下教务处老师。因为交换生系统也是教务处做的，包括学生排名也是教务处决定。可联系教务处于老师询问此事，电话是89680375。 

Q:关于牛津大学曼斯菲尔德学院的相关问题的回复？
A:1. 英语成绩
之前学院给的宣传报名材料中对英语成绩的描述比较模糊，这几天我们在学校层面沟通的时候，才意识到大学对于正式注册的学生（非英语国家）的英语成绩都有统一、严格的要求：雅思（IELTS: overall score of 7.0 with at least 7.0 in each of the four components）或托福（TOEFL internet-based: overall score of 110 with component scores of at least: Listening 22, Reading 24, Speaking 25, and Writing 24.）因为过去主要访问生都是来自美国等English speaking国家，学院层面并没有意识到大学层面对英语成绩的硬性要求。
因此，希望尽量选拔已经有符合要求的雅思或托福成绩的学生。无相关英语成绩的学生也同样有机会入选面试，但最终需提供符合牛津入学语言成绩要求才能获得牛津大学的unconditional offer，如无法按时提供合格语言成绩，将需要把名额让给waiting list上候选同学。
（大家也可参考https://www.ox.ac.uk/admissions/undergraduate/international-students/english-language-requirements?wssl=1）
 
2. 名额
这一年做为牛津大学访问学生计划-中国的pilot year，申请时间和名额都非常有限，今年限定人数为4到6名学生。明年名额将会逐步扩大。已经决定会扩展到另外几个学院和更广泛的专业选择。所以，希望今年能推荐1或2名同学，对方学校统一安排面试。
 
3. 接收专业
请大家参考牛津大学曼斯菲尔德学院宣传材料中所列出的专业。为保证tutorial的教学质量以及学生能够顺利完成学业，学院方面不是很鼓励本身专业不在接收专业中的申请。
 

Q:申请出国交换的材料是一定要规定日期当天送到教务处，还是可以提前送到教务处呢？
A:材料可以提前交给教务处。

Q:在递交材料的截止日期之前可能拿不到纸质托福成绩单，是否可以先提供成绩单截图及打印件，等纸质成绩单拿到了再出示？
A:可以先提交截图，国际处会协助和对方说明。 

Q:暑期伯克利项目的交换费用及接机事宜？
A:（1）此项目有几个session，时长不同费用也不同，具体可以在我们网页通知提供的网址上查询。
（2）对方没有接机，需要自行前往学校。建议最好与同去的同学一起结伴。

Q:关于奥地利参加欧亚-太平洋联盟交流项目的若干注意事项？
A:（1）导师推荐证明都需要英文或者德语来出具。职称如对方没有要求，教授或副教授都可以。
（2）在读证明在研究生院办理，无需等到名单出来，及无需外事办同意申请的证明。
（3）若申报此项目，首先向研究生院报名，并填写人员信息表发至stuex@nju.edu.cn，然后进行网申。 

Q:如果对方学校需要提名信，该如何开具？
A:提名信需要自己到国际处学生交流科来开具，地址是：仙林校区扬州楼822。

Q:申请交换项目时，成绩与排名如何填写？
A:GPA和排名都不需要学生自己算，按照教务处给出的成绩单上的数据为准。

title: 问答在线  /  录取通知发放环节_南京大学国际合作与交流处 学生交流科
text:
Q:我想问在国外交换期间是否一定要修读我们专业的相关课程？
A:不一定的，不过如果你所在院系有兑换学分的要求，走前一定要和你所在的院系确认选的课程是否回来后可以进行学分转换。

Q:交换生已经收到来自对方大学的电子版的录取通知书，但是大使馆需要纸质版本，则学生需要打印出来还是需要对方国际快递原版的录取通知书呢？
A:纸质版的录取材料需要学生自己联系对方学校，让对方寄到国际处学生科，寄达之后我们会通知你们来领取。
寄送地址是：
Section of Student Exchange Programs,
DOU-JI-ZHA Building, Office of International Cooperation and Exchanges, Nanjing University
Gulou Campus, 22 Hankou Road, Gulou District, Nanjing, China
Post code: 210000
Tel: 86-25-89683371

Q:某些学校项目在交换流程中没有发送纸质版的录取函，全程网上确认，只有邮件通知以及申请界面的显示，但向国际处递交出国审批表时要求附上录取函，这种情况应该怎么办？
A:你只要截图递交即可，无需向学校索要纸质版。另外，请将截图材料和出国审批表递交至国际处出入境管理科（仙林校区扬州楼822室），他们会做相关出国手续办理。
 

Q:参与短期研修项目，在学校通知入选后，没有收到进一步通知，接下来应该怎么做？
A:短期自费性质的研修班的申请通常分为两个步骤：本校备案，外方网申（学生自己完成）；所以我们没有对个人进行具体的通知。请按照国际处网站的相关通知及时完成网申。
 

Q:什么时候、如何获取录取通知书？
A: 一旦外方学校将录取通知书寄送到我科办公室，我们会email或电话通知学生前来我科办公室领取。
领取地点在仙林校区扬州楼822室。

title: 问答在线  /  返校环节_南京大学国际合作与交流处 学生交流科
text:
Q:关于交换成绩单领取
A:交换结束以后，一般来说，交换学校会把成绩单寄到国际处，国际处拿到成绩单以后会给学生发邮件，学生收到邮件后可在办公时间内到国际处学生科（扬州楼822）领取。

Q:成绩单领取前需要做的事？
A:根据规定，须要同学先递交《交流总结》后，方可领取交换成绩单等证明材料。
交流生返校后，须在一个月内通过电子邮件形式向国际合作与交流处学生交流科提交《交流总结》（中文）。要求：字数在2000字以上，宋体小四，单倍行距，附至少2张彩色照片。图片格式：jpg格式，图片最低分辨率：450dpi，图片大小：最好为横长型。
提交邮箱：stuex@nju.edu.cn待我们确认你的《交流总结》email至指定邮箱后，提交报告后方可领取交换成绩单等证明材料。
 

Q:如果参加了大三下学期的交换项目，有的课程就要到大四下学期才能补上，是否会影响到取得学位证书的时间？
A:原则上只要在毕业前修够满毕业所需学分就没有问题。不过关于学分的问题解释权归教务处，最好请咨询一下教务处老师。

Q:兑换的学分转换表在哪里下载？
A:请具体查看网页信息：http://stuex.nju.edu.cn/a/jlqjsxz/
学生应登录自己的交换生系统账户后，在里面填写好资料后直接下载打印。

Q:参与交换项目完毕，返校后需要做哪些事情？交换期间的成绩是否能直接显示在南大成绩单上？
A:返校后你还需向国际处学生交流科提交交流小结，同时领取你的成绩单。拿到成绩单后可以去学校教务处或研究生院兑换学分，关于交流学分是否能直接显示在南大成绩单上的问题，还请具体咨询一下教务处或研究生院负责学分转换的老师。具体联系方式可去教务处或研究生院网站上查询。

Q:国外大学成绩单寄送的速度是怎样的？
A:一般情况下国际快递需要一周左右，如果是平邮可能需要半个多月。

Q:回国返校后转换学分的程序是什么？
A:（1）返校后填写教务处规定的学分认定申请表或南京大学研究生校外成绩转换申请表（可在国际处学生交流科网页的“下载中心”下载）；
（2）本科生将学分转换认定申请表和对方高校成绩单及相关的课程内容介绍或教学大纲递交至所在院系，由教学院长指定相关课程的审核老师进行审核； 然后将经院系审批同意的表格提交至学校教务处；
（3）研究生请将成绩转换申请表和对方高校交流成绩单提交至研究生院培养办公室；
（4）教务处和研究生院依据表格信息进行复审和成绩录入。 

Q:项目结束返校后需要做什么？
A:参加项目学生应履行校友义务，为下届参加项目的同学给予指导和帮助。在项目结束返校后，交流生须在一个月内通过电子邮件形式向我处提交《交流总结》（中文），回顾其交换生活，详细描述交换学校的学习、生活和管理等情况。要求：字数在2000字以上，宋体小四，单倍行距，附至少2张彩色照片。图片格式：jpg格式，图片最低分辨率：450dpi，图片大小：146px*106px。提交报告后方可领取交换成绩单等证明材料。
请将材料发送至以下邮箱：
stuex@nju.edu.cn

title: 问答在线  /  欧盟项目_南京大学国际合作与交流处 学生交流科
text:
问题汇总
        

请输入你的问题的关键词：




Question检索词
Answer检索词





搜  索







校内初选环节
申请材料准备环节
录取通知发放环节
手续办理环节
返校环节
欧盟项目
国家留学基金委项目
其他






Q:已经申报欧盟交换项目，可否于结果公布前申请其他交换项目？
A:若为研究生，根据研究生院规定，结果出来前不得再报名其他交换项目。
若为本科生，请咨询教务处的老师申报项目优先级的规定。一般情况下，已申报欧盟项目的同时再申报其他项目，在名单排序上会有所靠后。
 

Q:填完欧盟项目的官网网申以后是不是还要填各个学校具体项目的网申？
A:根据欧盟官网的要求，如果是申请非学位项目，只需完成官网网申即可。
如果是学位项目，还须去意向学校官网进行网申。






共 1 页/2 条记录

title: 问答在线  /  校内初选环节_南京大学国际合作与交流处 学生交流科
text:
Q:关于教务处报名系统故障不能申报的问题
A:交换生管理系统由教务处负责，详情请向教务处于老师咨询电话：89680375，或邮箱：jwcexchange@nju.edu.cn

Q:专硕学生是否可以参加对外交流？
A:一般对于专硕，我们国际处没有特别限制。和学硕一样。但是研究生院会有一些规定，这点我们不是非常清楚，需要你再去咨询一下研究生院专硕的分管部门，专硕的联系方式如下。仙林校区：行政北楼907，89686492

Q:如果申请的项目第一志愿第二志愿都通过了，是必须去第一志愿吗？
A:如果也是自费项目，应该没有绝对优先级之说。如果是限定名额合作项目或者奖学金性质项目，肯定要以第一志愿为准了。仅此参考，具体还请再咨询教务处。 

Q:研究生交换项目：1.责任书是否需要提前提交？2.是不是确定得到推荐之后才开始进行校内网申（研究生），再提交材料？还是校内网申也要在推荐之前？3.因为不确定是否能被推荐，所以能不能同时申请几个项目？
A:1.如果你最终入选了交换项目，责任书的递交我们会提前统一邮件通知的。2.如果你确定要报这个项目，你首先要在研究生申报系统中报名该项目，填写相应的表格。研究生院会把选拔出的候选人名单给我科。我科会发邮件给入选的候选人，通知候选人去准备申请材料。3.关于能否同时申请几个项目，建议你咨询一下研究生院的老师，电话89682463。

Q:教务处交换生系统报名时，第一志愿与第二志愿的录取优先级是如何取舍的？
A:按教务处的规定，一般按照第一志愿项目作为第一优先级。具体可咨询教务处，电话：89680375。

Q:是否报名后名单就会被确定下来，没有更改放弃机会呢？或者是说在此之后只要不进行网申就可以放弃？
A:报名后，名单不会立刻确定，须经教务处的选拔确定名单。被教务处确定为候选人到被对方大学录取期间如果想要放弃项目的话，需和教务处和国际处报备，确认交换生系统中删除姓名。

Q:在申请交换时会要我选择志愿的顺序，那我的志愿的顺序的具体作用是怎么样的呢？
A: 志愿顺序一般是你最倾向参加的项目放在第一位。第二或第三志愿就是你的次选择。

Q:参加短期交换项目是否会对参加长期交换项目有影响？比如我在这个暑假参加了一个短期项目，那么是否还能申报下下个学期的长期交换项目？如果可以，曾经参加过短期项目是否会影响长期项目的优先级？如果是先参加了长期项目，那之后还能否参加短期项目呢？曾经的经历是否有影响呢？
A:参加短期项目对长期项目没有影响。
本科生可以在大学四年里参加一个长期项目（自费或免学费都可），和一个短期项目（只能自费）；也可以同时参加两个短期项目，但都要注意错开参加时间，以免参加项目时间冲突。
免学费的长期项目本科生四年内只能参加一次。
像你的情况，参加了暑期的一个短期项目的话，你可以在下下个学期再申请一个长期项目（自费或免学费都可），或者一个短期项目。
如果是先参加了长期项目，之后也能参加短期项目，但短期项目最好是自费的。
曾经的经历不会有影响。

Q:已申请一项短期项目，是否可以再申请长期项目？
A:可以。但建议两个项目参加时间不要冲突。 

Q:研究生申请短期自费交流项目需要经过学院和研究生院考核吗？
A:因项目是短期自费项目，不需经过研究生院的遴选，只需国际处统计人员即可。

Q:有些大学交流项目通知说明交流时间为一学年。研究生二年级学生能否有资格报名？
A:研究生二年级是可以报名的，但学生要安排好自己的学业，以免耽误毕业。

Q:关于伯克利大学的项目，要是没有托福雅思成绩，是否可以接受呢？是否只要通过面试就可以呢？
A:伯克利项目要求必须提供语言成绩，托福要求90以上，雅思要求7分以上，满足任意一项即可。这是校方的强制规定，所以如果没有语言成绩就不可以参与本项目，可以考虑其他项目。

Q:本科生已经完成相关项目的网申并在交换生系统里提交了申请。是否需要请院内辅导员和教务员对我的申请进行审核与通过？是否需要提交表格至国际处？
A:完成交换生系统的申请后，需要请院系负责人或辅导员进行审核通过，上报教务处。由教务处审核该生是否具有校荐资格，并报国际处提名给外方。

Q:已经报名某交换项目，如果校荐没有选上，我还能报名其他交换项目么？
A:可以的。

Q:我在交流伙伴学校的网站上看到他们另一个项目的介绍也很好，想问一下是否想要申请交流的项目，必须是我们国际处已经给出的？
A:是的，必须是国际处给出的。虽然外国的各类学校有很多项目，能给我们学校的项目要有两个条件，一是要看该学校是否是我们的伙伴学校，如果是的话，我们才能发布；二是即使该学校是我们的伙伴学校，虽然该学校有很多不同的项目，需要对方学校给我们发布项目通知，我们才能发布。
 
 

Q:已报名一个短期项目，尚未得到录取结果，是否还可以再申报另一个短期项目？
A:建议慎重考虑，如果你被其中之一的项目选中还是很好的。但也存在一种可能，就是如果你都被入选，意味着必须放弃一个，同时也意味着有一个名额本该可以给其他南大学子的，但必须得要浪费了。所以我们不建议你同时报两个同时期举行的项目。可以持续关注我们发布的其他时间的项目。

Q:导师推荐信是否只需要导师的签名，是否需要盖有导师的个人印章？
A:推荐信导师签名就可以了，不一定需要签章的。
 

Q:我有意向参与德国的交换项目，请问德国的交换项目是否基本是留给德语系的同学的？是否有对非德语系同学开放的交换项目？
A:我们学校与德国的交换生合作学校主要是哥廷根、弗莱堡和奥古斯堡三所大学。这些学校一般会每个学期给我们发布项目通知，发布通知的时间不固定。所以你需要及时关注我们网页上的通知：http://stuex.nju.edu.cn/德国学校中有些项目会有德语要求，但也有些项目是不需要德语要求的。一般语言要求是托福或雅思，如果对方学校有相关院系的要求，我们会在通知里面注明的。
 

Q:由于学期安排不同，某些交换项目的开始日期早于我校期末考试结束时间，如何处理？
A:这种情况下，需要调节好自己课程和交换时间的关系，必要时与辅导员或院系协商，办理缓考等手续。建议同学们不要选择这种有冲突的项目，最好选择一个时间宽松的项目。

Q:国际交流与合作学生交流科网页的问题汇总中写到“如果同类别项目派出时间重合，只可申请一个项目，一旦发现重复申请，将取消申请所有海外交流项目的资格。”就是说我在不知道学校是否推荐的情况下也只能申请一个项目么？
A:多个申报应是不影响的，但是录取时候，只会录取在一个项目里。由于校内选拔经由教务处，可以再咨询一下教务处相关负责老师。
教务处咨询邮箱：jwcexchange@nju.edu.cn

title: The University of Manchester_南京大学国际合作与交流处 学生交流科
text:
The University of Manchester
时间:2016-02-27 17:33　来源:未知　作者:chenxiaoqing　
              点击:   
              
              






Fall assessment approval form.pdf







Study Plan.pdf







Personal Statement.pdf







Nomination Form.pdf







网申指南.pdf




Following the recent changes to UK Visa and Immigration policy on English language requirements, we would like to provide you with an update on the recent UKVI changes and how these affect students joining the Study Abroad/Exchange programme at The University of Manchester.
 
IELTS:        
• The University of Manchester accepts the IELTS Academic test for entry to the Study Abroad Programme.       
• This includes BOTH the new UKVI-IELTS test (ie. a test taken at one of the 100+ worldwide Approved Testing Centres) AND the non-UKVI IELTS (ie. a test taken at a non-approved centre).                
• If a student requires a Tier 4 Visa for degree-level study in the UK, we can provide a CAS for their visa application based on EITHER a UKVI-IELTS test OR a non-UKVI IELTS test. The reason The University of Manchester is permitted to accept the non-UKVI IELTS test is that it has authority from UKVI to "vouch" for the validity of the test (ie. we have institutionally assessed that the test is acceptable). Some other UK universities may have taken an alternative approach to “vouching”, so please check the requirements with each of your partners.                       
• Students taking a Pre-Sessional English programme of 3, 5 or 10 weeks with us can also provide either a UKVI IELTS or non-UKVI IELTS certificate in support of their application. In these cases, we can issue a Joint CAS (ie. a CAS that will allow students to apply for a combined Tier 4 Visa covering both the Pre-Sessional English and the academic component of their programme).                
• Our minimum entry requirements are a 6.0 overall, with no less than 5.5 in any individual component. Please note that from September 2016, students will ALSO need to meet any higher scores set by individual subject areas - details are on our website here: http://www.manchester.ac.uk/study/international/study-abroad-programmes/study-abroad/entry-requirements/               
 
 
TOEFL:             
• The University of Manchester accepts the TOEFL iBT for entry to the Study Abroad Programme.                   
•  If a student requires a Tier 4 Visa for degree-level study in the UK, we can provide a CAS for their visa application based on a TOEFL iBT test. The reason The University of Manchester is permitted to accept the TOEFL iBT test is that it has authority from UKVI to "vouch" for the validity of the test (ie. we have institutionally assessed that the test is acceptable). Some other UK universities may have taken an alternative approach to "vouching", so please check the requirements with each of your partners.            
• Students taking a Pre-Sessional English programme of 3, 5 or 10 weeks with us can also provide a TOEFL iBT certificate in support of their application. In these cases, we can issue a Joint CAS (ie. a CAS that will allow students to apply for a combined Tier 4 Visa covering both the Pre-Sessional English and the academic component of their programme).           
• Our minimum requirement on this test is 79. Please note that from September 2016, students will ALSO need to meet any higher scores set by individual subject areas - details are on our website here: http://www.manchester.ac.uk/study/international/study-abroad-programmes/study-abroad/entry-requirements/       
 
PEARSON TEST OF ENGLISH (PTE), CAMBRIDGE ENGLISH- ADVANCED (CAE) AND CAMBRIDGE ENGLISH- PROFICIENCY (CPE):         
• A decision on the acceptability of these qualifications for future entry points will be made later this year. Very few Study Abroad/Exchange students present these tests.       
 
TRINITY COLLEGE LONDON TEST
• This is one of the two English Language tests on the UKVI approved list (the other being UKVI-IELTS). The University of Manchester does not currently accept the Trinity College London test for admissions purposes.
 
There is now only one circumstance in which the UKVI-IELTS test is the ONLY test which can be accepted. This is where a student is taking a stand-alone Pre-Sessional English language course, where separate CAS’s are to be issued for the Pre-Sessional course and the main Study Abroad/Exchange Programme. This would only usually be the case where a student is applying for a 20 week Pre-Sessional English programme with us, which is very rare.
 
A couple of other updates regarding the Tier 4 Visa application process:                       
• Students applying for a Tier 4 Visa will now need to pay an Immigration Health Charge (in excess of £200) before they can complete their Visa application.                  
• Students will now no longer receive their full Tier 4 Visa in their passport. Instead they will receive a visa that allows them to enter the UK 30 days before their programme of study starts, and they must then physically collect a biometric residence permit card from a location in Manchester shortly after their arrival. Students can choose to have their biometric residence permit delivered directly to The University of Manchester by entering our institutional code, which is 2HE372, into the alternative location field of the biometric collection page of the online visa application.        
 
Given this new expense and inconvenience, we would encourage students who are only joining us for one semester to enter the UK on a Short-Term Student Visa (which does not require a CAS), rather than applying for a Tier 4 Visa. Attached is an information sheet which we send to all accepted students explaining the pros and cons of each of these Visa routes. Students joining us for the full academic year will always need a Tier 4 Visa.

title: Admission  /  Study Opportunities at NJU  /  Double Degree Programmes_Section of Student Exchange Programmes Office of International Cooperation and Exchanges
text: Welcome to Office of International Cooperation and Exchanges！

title: Guide for Students > Visa_Section of Student Exchange Programmes Office of International Cooperation and Exchanges
text:
Visa and Residence Permits
 

 
Visas and residence permits are important documents for the legal residence of international students in China. They determine whether a student can study at ease during their time at the school, as well as easily finish their studies. Visas and residence permits are, however, relatively complex matters, and different situations require different complicated procedures to handle them. Students should therefore read and understand the following material in detail, and may consult the International Students’ Services Office of Institute for International Students on any aspect which remains unclear. This ensures that for the time of your study, your visa and residence permit will not become a problem.
 
Students who are under an X1 visa and will stay at Nanjing for more than half a year need to apply for a residence permit which allows you to have the multiple entry. These students must go to Nanjing Public Security Bureau to apply for a residence permit within 30 days, after entering China.  
  
These students should bring the following materials to the Entrance and Exit Affairs office of the Nanjing Public Security Bureau to handle the residence permit application procedures:
1)  “Certificate of Health” issued by the Nanjing Public Health and Quarantine Bureau.
2)  “Application for Visa and Residence Permits” issued by the school.
3)  “Application Form for International Students Entrance Visa” (JW201 or JW202).
4)   A valid passport with an X type visa and its copy
5)  “Temporary Residence Registration Form” offered by the local police substation
6)   Two passport-sized photos
 
Students under an X2 visa must register at the nearest local police station with your passport within 24 hours after moving in your room. 
 
If X2 holders would like to apply for the multiple entry, please do the same procedures as X1 holders.
 
The address of Entrance and Exit Affairs office of Nanjing Public Security Bureau: No. 173, Bai-Xia Road
Consultation Number: 86-25-84420005 
Visa Information Number: 86-25-84420014/84420024
 
Notice: 
1. If your living address has changed during your study in NJU, please go to the Nanjing Public Security Bureau (for X1 holders) or the nearest local police station (for X2 holders) again, within 10 days, to update your information and residence permit. 
2. If you have any question concerning your visa, you can go to Room 518, Zeng Xianzi Building (Gulou) for help. Tel: 86-25-83592473.
 

 


Notices of Applying for Residence Permits
 
1. Proof and Record of Physical Examination
 
New students coming from abroad need to go to Jiangsu International Travel Health Care Center to hand in proof of a physical examination for verification. A “Health Certificate” will be issued to those who pass the verification.
 
If a student's documents do not meet requirements, they must undergo another health inspection, and will receive their “Health Certificate” after passing the examination.
 
Residence permits for a stay shorter than 12 months do not require a health inspection, while residence permits for 12 months or longer do; however, physical examinations are always necessary for processing a second residence permit.
 
2. Residence Permit Validity
 
The duration of a residence permit's validity is usually the same length as the period for which students are allowed to study in NJU, and cannot exceed the duration of one's passport's validity.
 
3. Updating Residence Permits
 
A. Who needs to do it?
Students who change their place of residence, passport number (by receiving a new passport), or their work unit (i.e., the university they attend), etc.
 
B. When should I do it?
Within 10 days of any change to your place of residence, passport number (by receiving a new passport), or their work unit (i.e., the university they attend), etc.
 
C. How do I do it?
Students should personally bring their student ID, a valid passport and one passport photo to the International Students’ Service Office and fill out an “Application for Visa and Residence Permit”.
Bring a valid passport and “Application for Visa and Residence Permit,” with an official stamp from the Institute for International Students and an attached personal photo, to the Exit Affairs Office of Nanjing Public Security Bureau to conduct procedures necessary for updating your residence permit.
 
D. What if I don't do it?
If you change programs and haven't already taken care of updating the program listed on your residence permit, you will be punished in accordance with relevant provisions of the “Law of the People's Republic of China on Control of the Entry and Exit of Aliens”.
 
4. Extending Residence Permits


A. Who needs to do it?
Those who will continue to study in China beyond their residence permit's expiration date will need to apply for an extension.
 
B. When should I do it?
Applications for residence permit extensions should be made at least one month before the permit's expiration.
 
C. How do I do it?
Students should personally bring their student ID, a valid passport and one passport photo to the International Students’ Service Office and fill out an “Application for Visa and Residence Permit”.
Bring a valid passport and “Application for Visa and Residence Permit,” with an official stamp from the Institute for International Students and an attached personal photo, to the Exit Affairs Office of Nanjing Public Security Bureau to conduct procedures necessary for updating your residence permit.
If you didn't turn in your “Health Certificate” the first time you applied for a residence permit, then you are required to turn it in when you apply for an extension.
 
D. What if I don't do it?
If your residence permit expires and you haven't already taken care of applying for an extension, but continue to remain in China, then you become an illegal resident and will be subject to fines, as stipulated in relevant provisions of the “Law of the People's Republic of China on Control of the Entry and Exit of Aliens”, and, in the most serious circumstances, be detained or deported.
 
 


Leaving the Country after Finishing Studies
When leaving mainland China after finishing their studies, international students must leave before the expiration of their visa or residence permit. If due to accident a student is unable to leave within the stipulated time, they must submit an application, and after approval must extend their visa or residence permit. 
 
Students who want to suspend their schooling must go to the Institute’s International Students’ Service Office to reduce their residence permit.  
 
Respecting Chinese Law and Associated Regulations
The legal rights of international students studying in China receive protection under Chinese law. Students must also respect the laws of China and the regulations of their school.

title: Guide for Students > Services for Everyday Life > Housing_Section of Student Exchange Programmes Office of International Cooperation and Exchanges
text:
Housing
 

 
On-campus Dorms
International students can stay in the international student’s dormitory on Gulou campus, or the dormitory on the Xianlin campus.
 
Note! Nanjing University incorporates both Gulou and Xianlin campuses. Gulou campus is located in downtown Nanjing. Xianlin campus is about 20 kilometers away from Gulou campus. 

 
Note! For the students who have recevied Chinese Government Scholarship or Confucius Sholarship could get FREE residence.  
 


How to apply on-campus accommodation?

You have to apply on-campus accommodation due to the limited spots of student dormitories. Please download the Accommodation Application Form from the following website:
http://stuex.nju.edu.cn/en/a/Download_Center/20160918/807.html
 
Please be well noted that:
 
1. Please email the filled Accommodation Application Form before October 30th (Exchange for spring semester) or April 30th (Exchange for fall Semester) to your coordinator with the other application materials.

 
2. Our office would arrange which building of dorms you will live according to the applicant number and actual situation of on-campus dorms. Students are not allowed to choose the building of dorms by themselves.
 
3. All the exchange students are recommended to live in Xianlin campus. Due to the limited amount of rooms, it is strongly suggested to live in double rooms. If you apply for a double-room, your roommate (the same gender) will be randomly assigned.
 
4. Reservation cannot be cancelled once you submit the application.
 
5. Applications overdue won’t be considered.  
 
6. NJU will assign students’ accommodation according to applications, students are not permitted to change rooms on their wills.
 
 
 

Buildings of Xianlin dorms
 
 
Dorm No. 18 in Xianlin Campus
Tel: 025-89681018

Dorm No. 18 could offer students the following facilities:
Beds, desks and chairs, mini bookshelf, air-conditioned, cable internet service, private bathroom furnished with 1 Chinese style toilet, 1 shower, and 2 sinks;
 

Electricity and Water using:
Living in Xianlin Campus dorms, you should buy electricity and water in advance. Therefore, please bring enough RMB cash with you when you are arriving in China.
You need to pay for the extra use. You should go to the Electricity Power Service Center, which is located in southwestern corner of District A in Dorm No. 1 to buy electricity. Top-up can be operated at the self-service machine or at the Electricity Power Service Center. Power failures repair please call 89681118.
 



Price of the Accommodation:
Single Room: 1500 Yuan RMB/one semester/person; 3000 Yuan RMB/one year/person (not including the fee of electricity and water)

Double Room: 750 Yuan  RMB/one semester/person; 1500 Yuan RMB/one year/person (not including the fee of electricity and water)

Every exchange student could get a single room in Dorm No.18.

 
For the details about the living regulations in Dorm No. 18, please download the following document "Accommodation Guidance for New Comers" and read it carefully:





Accommodation Guidance for New Comers.doc





 
Notice: Each room has three beds, because it was used to be as the dorm for three people.
If any student wants to share the room with another exchange student (must be the same gender) from the same university, please email to inform us in advance . In this case, you could pay by standard of double room.

 

 

 

 

 

 

Dorm No 21 in Xianlin Campus 

A dormitory deposit of 600 Yuan RMB for the facilities and 50 Yuan RMB for the room key is required upon check-in. Please appropriately use and care for these facilities and the room key so that it will be able to return 650 Yuan RMB deposit when you check out.
Tel: 025-89681068/025-89681078
Address: International Students Apartment, #21 Building, Xianlin Campus

Price of the Accommodation:
Single Room: 6000 Yuan RMB/one semester/person; 12000 Yuan RMB/one year/person (not including the fee of electricity and water)
Double Room: 3000 Yuan  RMB/one semester/person; 6000 Yuan RMB/one year/person (not including the fee of electricity and water) 
 Facilities in dorms:
Beds, desk and chair, mini bookshelf, air-conditioned, cable internet service

 

 

 


 
 


Notice:  
1.    All the exchange students are recommended to live in Xianlin campus. Due to the limited amount of rooms, it is strongly suggested to live in double rooms.
2.   Electricity in your room will be charged in advance (payment must be made by yourself later on), which would be enough for the first few days’ usage. You have to charge the electricity fee using your campus card as soon as possible.

3.  International students living in the Xianlin campus’s student dormitory should pay their room fees according to the stipulated time period. Rent may be paid by semester or by school year.
4.  The bedclothes cannot be provided in dorms on Xianlin Campus. You have to purchase it in advance. NJU will provide a package which includes all the things you may need in your room. The package includes the articles listed in the following form. The price for the package is about 500 Yuan RMB. You can buy it when you check-in room. Please be aware that the payment can only be made in cash.
List of articles for bedding and daily life 



 
 

List of articles for bedding and daily life 
 
 
5. Coin laundry is located at the ground floor of Dorm No.21 and Dorm No.18 in Xianlin campus. Each time will cost you 3 to 5 Yuan RMB for washing. 

 

 
How to top up electricity fee? 
 
Please make sure that your campus card has been charged with enough money firstly, then you could start the next steps to do electricity recharge. (Please go to the pages of “About Campus Card” to find the instructions of campus card recharge.)
 
Use the campus card to top up at the self-service machine. There is a self-service machine on the ground floor of each dormitory building. Be sure to charge enough cash into the campus card in advance. Then you could transfer the money in campus card for electricity recharge on self-service machine.
Click buttons of “校园卡务”(campus card service)------“电费充值”(Electricity Recharge) on self-service machine.

 


Self-service machine
 
 
The procedure for charging electricity fee: 


 

 

 
 
 

Commonly used telephone numbers on campus
Nanjing University Police: 86-25-89685110
Fire alarm on campus: 86-25-89685110
Campus hospital: 86-25-89685120
Management & Service Office for dorms in Xianlin Campus: 86-25-89680089
Electricity Power Service Center: 86-25-89681118
Network Information Center: 86-25-89683791/89684793
Campus Card Service Center: 86-25-89686529
Telecom business hall: 86-25-89681114
Post office: 86-25-89681112
Library: 86-25-89682324
Gymnasium: 86-25-89680100
Robbery and Theft: 110
Fire: 119
Traffic Accident: 122
Medical Emergency: 120
 
 


Xiyuan Dorms in Gulou Campus
If you choose to live in Xiyuan Hotel, please go to the hotel service desk to complete necessary housing procedures and sign a housing contract.
Tel: 86-25-83593589
Address (in English): 20 Jinyin Street, Gulou, Nanjing. Xiyuan Hotel, NJU
Address (in Chinese): 金银街20号（近上海路），南京大学鼓楼校区状元楼西苑宾馆
Price of the Accommodation:
XiYuan offers a twin room for about 52 Yuan RMB/person/day, and a single room for about 67 Yuan RMB/person/day.
International students living in the international student’s dormitory should pay their room fees according to the stipulated time period. They must pay a RMB 650 Yuan materials deposit and an RMB 1000 Yuan rent deposit. Rent may be paid by month, in which case rent is paid during the 25th and 30th of each month. If students check out, rent is calculated up to the day students return their key.
Facilities in dorms:
Beds, blanket, pillow, dresser, wardrobe, desk and chair, mini bookshelf, phone, air-conditioned, cable internet service
Electricity:
Please go to the service desk on the ground floor of Xiyuan dorm to purchase electriciy. Each time you must purchase at least 100 degrees (KWh) of electriciy.
 


 

 
 

Notices for on-campus accommodation
 
1. It is forbidden to use high power electrical equipment in dorms (like electric stove, electric kettle, and so on), for your own safety. Smoking is also forbidden in dorms. Please make sure you treat the facilities in dorms with care. You should be ordered to pay compensation for the breakages on the objects in dorms.
 
2. If you find any damages on the furniture or water and electricity facilities, please notify to the staffs in the Management & Service Office in dorm building and let them to help you to repair the facilities.
 
3. When you leave for a long time or come back after a long holiday, you should do the registration in the Management & Service Office in dorm building. It is forbidden to accommodate any guests in dorms. Any guests who visit your dorms for a short time should do a registration in the Management & Service Office.
 
4. If you discover fires in dorms, please call the safety services office: 86-25-89685110 or 119 immediately.
 
5. Living in Xianlin Campus dorms, you should buy electricity in advance. Therefore, please bring enough RMB cash with you when you are arriving in China. You need to pay for the extra use. You should go to the Electricity Power Service Center, which is located in southwestern corner of District A in Dorm No. 1 to buy electricity. Top-up can be operated at the self-service machine or at the Electricity Power Service Center. Power failures repair please call: 86-25-89681118.
 
6. Please be sure to live in the exact room that has been assigned to you. Changing rooms without notification is not allowed. Rooms are randomly assigned to individual. If you do need to change the room due to some reasons, please notify the staff in Management & Service Office and our office.
 
7. Be sure to close your door tightly and turn off all water faucets and lights when you leave your room.
 
Notices for off-campus accommodation
 
1. Our office cannot arrange off-campus accommodation for students.
2. Students living off campus should settle their rent fees on time, in order to avoid unnecessary legal disputes.
3. Students may also live in off-campus accommodations, but must, in accordance with regulation, go to their place of residence's local public security bureau to handle registration procedures. When living off campus, it is absolutely necessary to ensure that the source of your housing information is reliable, that rental procedures are entirely legal, and to have your landlord file your rental permit at the local public security bureau, as well as to visit the local public security bureau yourself to apply for a temporary residence registration. 
 
3. It's necessary to ensure that all the rental procedures complete, legitimate, and reliable.

 
 
Off-campus Housing
 

Students can also live off campus. However, according to regulations they must register at their local police dispatch station. Here we remind everyone, when living off campus you must be sure that the source of information on your housing is reliable, and that rent procedures are completed according to law. You must also allow your landlord to bring your rent permit to the local police dispatch station to enter it into record, and yourself go to the dispatch station to apply for a temporary residence registration. In summary, you must ensure that all procedures for renting a residence are complete, legal, and reliable.
 
Due to the fact that international students’ accommodation planning in Gulou campus is very tight, self-paying students upon arriving can first live in surrounding economical hotels which are convenient and equipped with necessary facilities.
 
Then students can look into renting an apartment near campus. They can find a decent apartment for around 2,500 RMB a month, and the farther away you live from campus, the cheaper it gets. Apartments can be found with the help of administrative staff, by word of mouth, or through street advertisements and other kinds of advertisements. 
 

Many students during their period of study change their address or method of contact, and in this situation students must remember to immediately inform the Student Service Office of their new address, phone number and e-mail address. This is so that the student services office can help students in updating their residence permit, and be able to inform students of important events in a timely manner. Only if we have accurate contact information can we maintain regular and unhindered communication, so that in the event you run across difficulties or problems, the student services office can help you without delay. The International Student Service Office will protect the privacy of your contact information.
 

Hotels recommended by former students:  
Jin’s Inn (address: 26 Yunnan Rd, Nanjing, Phone: 400-828-9966. 86-25-83755666)

title: Guide for Students > Buddy Programme_Section of Student Exchange Programmes Office of International Cooperation and Exchanges
text:
Buddy Programme
 

 
JOIN US！
Do you plan to meet your buddy for a coffee or tea? Or would you like to discuss different cultures, talk about university life and get to know new people? Or do you want to meet interesting people from all over the world who speak English, French, German, Korean, Japanese, Spanish and other languages? Join our buddy program and Buddy WeChat Group! ☺
 
Buddy Program is a cross-cultural communication project under the framework of Association of International Communication (AIC) and Students International Exchanges & Cooperation Association (SIECA), which pairs new international students with current students of NJU, and aims to help international students settle into NJU.
 
Buddy Program will bridge and facilitate exchanges between the international and Chinese students and thereby providing a platform for cross-border opportunities and joint cooperation. 
 
You would be invited to join Buddy Program at NJU, in which individual NJU students would pair with you to help you get involved in the new environment. They may help you get familiar with NJU upon your arrival, and may invite you to activities where you could get more communication with domestic students.
 
Members from AIC and SIECA would contact you at the beginning of the semester, or even before your arrival via email. If you have any questions about the study and life in NJU before or after your coming to China, you could contact your buddy by email. Your buddy will be happy to give your support and help. Wish you a nice friendship with your buddy.
 
The Buddy Program will always set up a WeChat chatting group, where all the important notices will be released by the buddy. Therefore, it is highly recommended that each exchange student could create your own WeChat account after your coming to China and join the Buddy WeChat Group. The Buddy WeChat Group Number will be announced in the orientation meeting.


 

 

 
Please refer to the Pamphlet of Buddy Program as following:




Pamphlet of Nanjing University Buddy Program. pdf



 

 

 

 

 

 

 
Various Events:
The welcome party of the semester Buddy Program 
Exploring Nanjing: A Tour to Nanjing Museum" 
Exploring Nanjing: A Culinary Tour  —— An International Cuisine DIY Party"
Hot Pot Party

title: Guide for Students > Costs & Fees_Section of Student Exchange Programmes Office of International Cooperation and Exchanges
text:
Costs and Fees

 
Insurance  


1. International Exchange Students must have comprehensive health insurance valid in China for enrollment as a full-time student at NJU. Since many insurance policies purchased outside China require substantial co-payments, have caps or exclude many illnesses, it is therefore urged that all incoming students should purchase a student health insurance when they do registration at NJU. 
Price: 400 Yuan RMB/one semester & 800 Yuan RMB/one academic year.

 
Please refer to the following document to find the details about Insurance:





Comprehensive Insurance Plan for Foreigners Studying in China--English.doc









Comprehensive Insurance Plan for Foreigners Studying in China--Chinese.doc





 
2. For students who got Chinese Government Scholarship (CSC Scholarship), Please read the detail information on the website: www.lxbx.net




Inpatient Medical Insurance.pdf








Outpatient Medical Insurance.pdf




 
 
Other Fees
1.	The Nanjing Public Health and Quarantine Bureau’s physical examination and examination certificate require you to pay fees.
2.	The Public Security Bureau’s Entrance and Exit Administration department requires fees for visa and residence procedures.
3.	To gain access to the school library and the Institute’s resource center requires a deposit of RMB 300 Yuan.
4.	To receive a campus card requires a service fee of RMB 20 Yuan.
5.	To use the campus’s tennis courts, ping-pong rooms, exercise rooms and indoor swimming pool, students must pay the standard fees for all students.
6.	Self-paying students’ meals, medical expenses, school materials, vacation travel expenses and extra-curricular experiments, fieldwork, and field trips, are all up to the student to cover.

title: Guide for Students > Application Procedure_Section of Student Exchange Programmes Office of International Cooperation and Exchanges
text:
Application:

 
 
 If you are an exchange student (Nominated by your home university), please see the following application procedure:
 
Nomination Deadline:  
Spring Semester: October 30th 
Fall Semester: April 30th
 
Eligibility 
According to current admission policy, applicants with Chinese Nationality are not allowed to apply as exchange students to study at NJU.
Language Requirement
--- HSK 5 For students who would like to choose Chinese-taught courses
--- IELTS 6 / TOEFL 70 - For students who would like to choose English-taught courses
 
Application Materials 
A: Official English transcript from home university;
B: A copy of passport photo page;
C: Personal passport photo of electronic edition;
Requirements of Photo:
Photo format: .JPG File
Photo size: Length: Width = 3:4
Electronic file size: between 50KB and 500KB
Background color: light color
Please indicate your full name as the title of your photo.
D: A certificate of Language Proficiency;
--- HSK 5 or above -For students who would like to choose Chinese-taught courses
--- IELTS 6 / TOEFL 70 or Testament of home institution stating that the student is proficient in English if no IELTS/TOEFL test scores are available. - For students who would like to choose English-taught courses 
E: Filled Accommodation Application Form
Download website:
http://stuex.nju.edu.cn/en/a/Download_Center/20160918/807.html
F: Physical Examination Record for Foreigner 
（You could download the form from this webiste: http://stuex.nju.edu.cn/en/a/Download_Center/20150805/64.html）
(for students who apply for one academic year’s exchange ONLY)
 
Application Step 1– by coordinator 
If the coordinator would like to nominate a student to study at Nanjing University, please complete and submit the Online Nomination Form in our Nomination System:
http://stuexdata.nju.edu.cn/index.php?m=Home&c=public&a=login
(We would offer “User ID” and “Password” to coordinator ONLY)
 
After nominating students online, please submit scanned copies of all above materials of your applicants to stuex@nju.edu.cn. (All documents pertaining to one student must be submitted in one file, with the student’s full name clearly indicated.) 
 
Please note that applications should be sent officially by coordinators of home universities. Personal application is not acceptable.
 
Please complete all application materials with clear information, including students’ full name, contact details, mailing address, etc. Poor handwriting may delay the admission process.
 
Application Step 2– by students 
Once being nominated, students should complete registration online by themselves: http://istudy.nju.edu.cn/member/login.do
 
Online registration open time: 
September 25th ---November 10th (For spring semester)
March 1st---May 10th (For fall semester)
 
Notice: Although exchange students are tuition-waived, when register in this online system, you should select “Self-Paying” as your enrollment type. 
 
Application Procedures of the students' online registration:
Please creat an User ID and password at first.
The registration page:

 
Step 1: Please select "Self-sponsored".

Step 2: Please select option as following:

Step 3: Please select option as following:

Step 4: Don't forget to add your passport photo here, as shown by the red arrow.

 
Step 5: Please fill in the blanks (Notice: The blanks which are labelled by the red dots are required to filled in. )

Step 6: Please fill in the blanks (Notice: The blanks which are labelled by the red dots are required to filled in. )

Step 7: Please fill in the blanks (Notice: The blanks which are labelled by the red dots are required to filled in. )

 

Step 8: Please fill in the blanks (Notice: The blanks which are labelled by the red dots are required to filled in. )
Please select the option of "Deliver to Address Provided in Application".

 
Step 9: After information confirmation, please click "Submit" buttion to finish your online applicaiton.
 

 


 
Insurance 
Exchange students must have comprehensive health insurance valid in China for enrollment as a full-time student at NJU. Since many insurance policies purchased outside China require substantial co-payments, have caps or exclude many illnesses. It is therefore urged that all incoming students should purchase a student health insurance when they do registration at NJU. 
400 Yuan RMB/one semester & 800 Yuan RMB/one academic year
 
Physical Examination 
Physical Examination is only required for one-year students.
The result of Physical Examination will be necessary in the applications for both Visa and Residence Permit in China.
Before registration, you should bring the original copies of the “Physical Examination Record for Foreigner”, and the “HIV, Syphilis, and Hepatitis Examination Report” to Jiangsu International Travel Health Care Center (No. 39 Chuang-Zhi Road) to have them verified.
Notice：
1. The Procedure at Jiangsu International Travel Health Care Center will require you to pay an application fee.
2. You may be required to do the examination of “HIV, Syphilis, and Hepatitis Examination Report” at Jiangsu International Travel Health Care Center. 
3. The examination of “Physical Examination Record for Foreigner” could be done in your home country in advance. Exchange students must take the original copy of “Physical Examination Record for Foreigner” by themselves to Nanjing University. Please DO NOT send it to our office.
4. Please download Form of “Physical Examination Record for Foreigner” from the following website:
http://stuex.nju.edu.cn/en/a/Download_Center/20150805/64.html 
 
Acceptance Notice 
Generally, Nanjing University will send acceptance letters by courtier in late June (for Autumn Semester) and late December (for Spring Semester). Acceptance letters will only be sent to home universities’ international offices. We won’t send them to students directly or to addresses other than international offices. 
 
How to apply on-campus accommodation?
You have to apply on-campus accommodation due to the limited spots of student dormitories. Please download the Accommodation Application Form from the following website:
http://stuex.nju.edu.cn/en/a/Download_Center/20160918/807.html  
Please be well noted that:
1. Please email the filled Accommodation Application Form before October 30th (For spring semester) or April 30th (For fall Semester) to your coordinator with the other application materials.
2. Reservation cannot be cancelled once you submit the application form. 
3. Applications overdue won’t be considered.  
4. NJU will assign students’ accommodation according to applications, students are not permitted to change rooms on their wills.
 
Consumption
Be sure to take enough amount of RMB in cash with you. In NJU campuses, your shopping in supermarkets, food and drink in canteens, and so on could only be done by cash. Credit card could not be used in Campuses.
 
Weather and Clothing
The average temperature in Nanjing in February is between 4-5°C, but it is possible that it could drop to below 0°C. It is advisable that you bring warm clothing that can be layered, such as shirts and sweaters, and a warm jacket. It may be wise to bring along a wind-and water-proof jacket, in case there may be rainy days.
 
Orientation Meeting
At the beginning of semester, our office would organize an orientation meeting for every exchange student for the introduction of study and life in NJU. We would email to inform you to take part in this orientation. Please be sure to come and have a notice with the announcement on our website and your email.

 
FAQs
Please note that due to the considerably large volume of enquiries which we are currently dealing with when you email to us for questions. We kindly ask for your patience and understanding until such time as we are able to respond to your email. 
Please click the following website of "Answers Online" at first:
http://stuex.nju.edu.cn/en/plus/list.php?tid=272
Please enter a key word in the searching blank to find the similar FAQs. Hope you could get a satisfactory answer from "Answers Online".

 

Impression of NJU
Please submit an essay about "Impression of NJU" to us during your stay in NJU. And in your essay, please write down your life and feelings in NJU to share with others and offer useful experiences to future foreign students. It is always required to have 2 or 3 colored photos in the essay. The preferred length is more than one A4 page, with 8 point size “Times New Roman” font. 
Your essay would be published on our website of “Impression of NJU”：http://stuex.nju.edu.cn/en/a/Impression_of_NJU/
Please email your essay to: stuex@nju.edu.cn

 
 
 

 If you are a self-paying student, please see the following application procedure: 
 
Please refer to the on-line website of Institute for International Students for application: http://www.studyinnju.com/
This application system is in charge by Institute for International Students, not our international office. 
You could also contact Admission Office of Institute for International Students. Please refer to the following Contact Information.
Our international office is not in charge of Self-Paying students. If you have any quesitons, please contact with the email address of Institute for International Students: issd@nju.edu.cn

 
 
Contact Information of Our Office（南京大学国际合作与交流处）
Office Name: Section of Student Exchanges, Office of International Cooperation and Exchanges 
Office Address: Room 822, North Administration Building in Xianlin Campus. You could check the map of Xianlin campus to find out the position our office.
Website: http://stuex.nju.edu.cn/en
Email: stuex@nju.edu.cn
Tel: 86-25-89683371 
 

Contact Information of Institute for International Students (南京大学海外教育学院)
Institute for International Students (IIS) is in the 5th floor of Zeng Xianzi Building in Gulou Campus. You could check the map of Gulou campus to find out the building of the Institute.
The Enrollment Service Office (Admission/Registration/ Arrival Certificate)
Room 514, ZENG Xianzi Building, Tel: 86-25-83594535
The International Students’ Service Office (Visa Affairs)
Room 518, ZENG Xianzi Building, Tel: 86-25-83592473
The Academic Affairs Office (Chinese language learning courses, making transcript)
Room 520, ZENG Xianzi Building, Tel: 86-25-83594613
The Teaching Material Office (Textbook Purchase)
Library on the 4th floor, ZENG Xianzi Building, Tel: 86-25-83593757
Website: http://hwxy.nju.edu.cn/en/ (in English), http://hwxy.nju.edu.cn/cn/ (in Chinese)

Email: issd@nju.edu.cn
 
 
Relevant Municipal Offices in Nanjing

Entrance and Ecit Affairs Office of Nanjing Public Security Bureau （南京市公安局出入境管理处）
Address: No. 173, Bai-Xia Road (南京市白下路173号)
Tel: 86-25-84420005
 
Jiangsu International Travel Health Care Center（江苏省国际旅行卫生保健中心）
Address: No. 39, Chuangzhi Road, Nanjing (南京市创智路39号)

title: Guide for Students > Services for Everyday Life > Shopping in Nanjing_Section of Student Exchange Programmes Office of International Cooperation and Exchanges
text:
Supermarket in Nanjing University
 
Supermarket in Gulou Campus:
Jiao-Yu Supermarket is located in the South part of Gulou Campus. You could also charge your money into campus card in Jiao-Yu Supermarket. 
 

Jiao-Yu supermarket in Gulou campus
 

Inside scene of the Jiao-Yu Supermarket
 
 
Supermarket in Xianlin Campus: 
 
Jiao-Yu Supermarket is located in the ground floor of Dorm No.2 in Xianlin Campus. You could also charge your money into campus card in Jiao-Yu Supermarket. 
 

Jiao-Yu supermarket in Xianlin campus
 
朝花夕拾超市
Another supermarket in Xianlin Campus is "Zhao Hua Xi Shi" supermarket, which is located in the 1st floor of Dorm No. 3 in Xianlin campus. 
 

"Zhao Hua Xi Shi" supermarket （朝花夕拾超市）
 
NJU Souvenirs Shops
All certificated souvenirs of NJU could be found at Jiao-Yu supermarkets in Xianlin campus or the gift shop named “Memory of NJU”（南大記憶）located near Hankou Road Gate in Gulou campus.

 

 

 

 
朝花夕拾 Shopping in Nanjing
 
Nanjing is the capital city and commerce and trade center of Jiangsu Province. You can always find satisfactory products at department stores, souvenir shops or vendor's stands.
 
Supermarkets: Suguo, Haodi, Jinrunfa, Carrefour, Auchan
 

Jin Runfa Supermarket
 

Hao You Duo Supermarket
 
Sporting facility stores: Decathlon
 
Shishang Laidi and Xinjiekou Undergound Plaza offers a variety of young people’s clothes, cosmetics and accessories. Shops there are privately run, and prices are quite low.

title: 出国留学 > 留学须知 > 交流学生须知_南京大学国际合作与交流处 学生交流科
text:
流程概述
 
 

 
 
请登录国际处学生交流科主页http://stuex.nju.edu.cn/, 关注“通知通告”栏目，随时关注外国各高校发布的项目信息通知，以便及时获取资料、办理报名申请手续等。
 
请有意报名海外交换项目的同学仔细阅读交流学生须知，及交流学习期间须知和交流期结束须知，具体的报名手续、申请程序、录取手续请见我们网页的“出国留学”----“具体流程”栏目。
 
1. 交流生定义：“交流学生”指由南京大学派出到与之有校际交流合作协议的国外大学进行交流学习的学生，含：交流生（exchange students，免学费）和访问生（visiting students or fee-paying students，自费）两种。交流学生只能在南京大学获取学位，不以获取接受大学的学位为目的。
 
2. 交流时间含短期和长期两种。长期项目的交流时间为三个月以上（含三个月），短期项目的交流时间为三个月以下。对于免外方学费的长期交流项目，南京大学注册学生本科四年内只限参加一次。所有参加校际交流项目的学生，不得以任何原因申请延长交流期限；若需申请，须遵循教务处或研究生院相关规定。
 
3. 报名参与交流的学生须遵循本校选拔交流学生的流程和结果。学生在报名参加交流时，须签订《南京大学校际学生国际交流项目责任书》(在学生交流科网页“下载中心”下载表格)；该协议“监护人”一栏，须由父母或法定监护人亲笔签名，其他任何人员不得代签。
 
4. 在获得南京大学推荐或国外大学及机构录取资格后，学生未经南京大学相关职能部门许可，不得擅自退出项目，否则学校将取消学生在南京大学学习期间参加其他国际交流项目的资格。
 
5. 如果确实因为不可抗拒的因素要求退出项目，须提出书面申请，填写《南京大学国际交流学生项目退出申请书》(在学生交流科网页“下载中心”下载表格)，由本人、所在院系的辅导员及教学院长、教务处/研究生院、国际处签字盖章后，递交教务处教学研究科/研究生培养办、以及国际处学生交流科备案。
 
6. 交流学习期满，学生须按时返校。学生不得擅自延长交流期限或者滞留他国。违反该项规定的学生，将依据学校相关规定处理。
 
7. 若学生在海外交流学习期间提出延长学习期限的要求，则延期学生须出具外方学校同意该生延期的证明，须外方大学的相关负责人签字或盖章，提供电子版扫描件证明；并且须填写《南京大学国际交流学生延期申请书》 (在学生交流科网页“下载中心”下载表格)，由本人、所在院系的辅导员及教学院长、教务处/研究生院、国际处签字盖章后，递交教务处教学研究科/研究生培养办、以及国际处学生交流科备案。
 
8. 延期学生在海外交流学习期间向南京大学相关职能部门提出延长学习期限且获得批准后，学生原先签署的《南京大学校际学生国际交流项目责任书》的所有条款和要求自动适用。延期学生在批准延长的学习期满后，应及时办理南京大学的返校手续。学分转换须与教务处或研究生院联系办理。
 
9. 获得录取的所有交流学生学籍仍在本校，交换生在对方大学交流期间产生的生活费和其他费用需自行承担；访问生需要按照对方学校的规定缴纳包括学费在内的所有费用。
 
10. 获得录取的学生需自行办理宿舍申请、签证申请、课程选择、健康体检、置办保险等个人事宜。关于课程选择适宜，须事先在申请国外大学之时征得本校所在院系相关负责老师的意见，以备回国后学分能够顺利转换。
 
11. 一般情况下，国外大学（尤其日本高校）会要求学生在出国前办理好健康证明和境外医疗保险，请学生务必遵照各个项目具体要求执行。体检报告表格请至对方大学网站下载，到南京市出入境检疫检验局进行体检。地址：南京市白下路1号。
 
12. 所有交流学生在办理签证前须下载本科生或研究生的《出国人员审批表》（注：本科生和研究生的表格是不同的。） （在学生交流科网页首页的“下载中心”下载）进行填写，并在相关院系和管理部门签字盖章，请于出国前将审批表连同录取通知书复印件一并交至国际合作与交流处出入境管理科（仙林校区扬州楼818室）。
 
13. 通常情况下，接收学校不负责接机事宜。若有需求，请学生提前和对方大学联系提出请求并支付相关费用或自行解决。
 
14. 交流生返校后，须在一个月内通过电子邮件形式向国际合作与交流处学生交流科提交《交流总结》（中文），回顾其交换生活，详细描述交换学校的学习、生活和管理等情况。要求：字数在2000字以上，宋体小四，单倍行距，附至少2张彩色照片。图片格式：jpg格式，图片最低分辨率：450dpi，图片大小：最好为横长型。提交报告后方可领取交换成绩单等证明材料。
提交邮箱：stuex@nju.edu.cn
 
15. 关于学分转换的事宜，须遵守本校院系和教务处的管理规定。对方大学通常在交流结束后将学生成绩单直接寄至国际合作与交流处，提交完毕《交流总结》后，方可领取交换成绩单等证明材料。
 
16. 学生自主出国（境）交流学习: 学生通过个人渠道或其他非校际合作性质的项目出国或出境进行短期学术交流活动（三个月以下），必须向所属院系提出申请，经院系负责人签字同意后方可参加交流。学生交流名单应由所属院系及时报送至相关职能部门备案。
 
17. 若学生计划自主出国（境）交流学习超过三个月，需同时征得所属院系和相关职能部门的同意后方可进行。学生自主出国（境）交流学习的一切费用和相关责任均由学生本人承担，所属院系学生管理办公室应对学生做好跟踪管理。
 
18. 其他未尽事宜，由南京大学国际合作与交流处负责解释。

title: Guide for Students > Academic Guide > Library Rules_Section of Student Exchange Programmes Office of International Cooperation and Exchanges
text:
Library Rules
 
Nanjing University Library is among the best university libraries in China.
All the libraries in both campuses also offer individual and group study spaces; many of them provide technical equipment and guarantee a silent atmosphere in which to work.
 

 
 
Library of Gulou Campus

Gulou library offers students an excellent reading atmosphere, and rich materials for studying and researching. Gulou library has 4 floors. It offers many reading rooms. You could use your campus card to get into the library and read books. 
Open Time: 8:00----22:00
 


The outside scene in Gulou library
 

 

The inside scene in Gulou library 
 
 
Duxia Library of Xianlin Campus

 
Du-Xia library is one of the most beautiful university libraries in China. It has 5 floors and 45 reading room. You could use your campus card to get into the library and read books. 
Open Time: 8:00----22:00


The outside scene in Du-Xia library
 

 

The inside scene in Du-Xia library

title: Guide for Students > Academic Guide > Extending Study Period_Section of Student Exchange Programmes Office of International Cooperation and Exchanges
text:
Extending Study Periods

 
According to the inter-university exchange agreement, an exchange student’s course of study will usually be either one semester or one academic year. If the exchange student wishes to extend their course of study, the deadline for that application is before May 30th and November 30th of every year. 
The procedure of applying for an extension to your course of study:
1. The exchange student first applies to their home university’s international office.
2. The home university’s international office confirms with NJU’s international office.
3. The student obtains official approval from both universities.
4. International exchange students extend their courses of study at the Academic Affairs Office of Institute for International Students.
5. International exchange students go to the International Students’ Service Office to extend their visas, residence permits, etc. (For the details about extending visas and residence permits, please go to the pages of “Visas and Residence Permits”).

Exchange students who need to extend duration for one more semester at NJU, should report to Office of International Cooperation and Exchanges of NJU (Section of Student Exchange Programmes) for the Certificate of Approval before May 30th.
Room 822, North Admistrative  Building, Xianlin Campus  

After getting the Certificate of Approval, please go to the International Students’ Service Office of Insititute for International Students (IIS for short) for visa extension.
Please contact: Mr.ZHU, Tel: 86-25-83592473, Room 516, Zeng Xianzi Building, IIS, Gulou Campus

title: Guide for Students > Academic Guide > Student Card_Section of Student Exchange Programmes Office of International Cooperation and Exchanges
text:
Student Cards
 
International students will be given a Nanjing University student card after enrollment.
 
Undergraduates and graduate students will receive a student card issued by the administrator of their department. If it is lost, please apply to the administrator for a replacement.
 
General Advanced students, special advanced students and research students will receive a student card issued by the Teaching Service Office of the Institute for International Students. If it is lost, please apply to this office for a replacement.
 
How to apply Student Card?
 
1. How to apply the Student Card (Undergraduate Students)
ONLY for the undergraduates:
Please bring one 2-inch photo with your Passport Names and Passport Numbers at the back and submit it to Room 503, Zeng Xianzi Building.
Application Time: First two weeks of each semester  9:30--11:00 14:30--16:00
Place: Room 503, Zeng Xian Zi Building, 
Pick-up Time: Get your student card in 5 working days at Room 503.
 
2. Graduate Students (Masters and Postgraduates)
Please go to your own department to apply the student cards after registration in Institute for International Students
 
3. Language Learners in Institute for International Students:
Please go to Students Academic Office in Institute for International Students (Office 520, Zeng Xianzi Building) and follow their application steps.
 
Note! The student card is an important piece of identification for international students. It should be carried at all times, and should not be lent out or given away. If it is lost, you must immediately take care of the matter.

title: 电话黄页
南京大学2016 - 2017学年校历
text: 南京大学2016 - 2017学年校历第一学期：2016年8月29日～2017年元月8日（共19周）。           报到注册：2016年8月29日(利用课余时间)。                  2016级新生报到时间见录取通知书。           上        课：2016年8月29日～12月25日（共17周）。           节日放假：国庆节放假三天，中秋、元旦各放假一天。           运  动  会：第9周在仙林校区举行秋季运动会。           下学期选课（网上）：全日制本科生第17周办理，研究生第18、19周办理。        复习考试：2016年12月26日～2017年元月8日（共2周）。           寒        假：全日制本科生、成教生2017年元月9日至2月19日（共6周）；研究生由导师根据培养计划自行安排。           第二学期：2017年2月20日～7月9日（共20周）。           报到注册：2017年2月20日（利用课余时间）。                            2017级成教新生报到时间见录取通知书。           上        课：2017年2月20日～6月25日（共18周）。           节日放假：清明、五一、端午各放假一天。            下学期选课（网上）：全日制本科生第18周办理，研究生第19、20周办理。        复习考试：2017年6月26日～7月9日（共2周）。           毕业生教育：2017年6月19日～7月1日，7月2日离校。           暑        假：全日制本科生、成教生2017年7月10日至9月3日（共8周）；研究生由导师根据培养计划自行安排。全日制本科生暑期学校：2017年7月10日～8月13日（共5周）。

校长办公室关于扫雪工作的通知

各院系、各单位：根据市、区有关冬季扫雪防冻工作的要求，为确保我校正常的教学、工作秩序，防止突然降雪带来的不利影响，现就校园及校外有关区域的扫雪工作通知如下：一、一旦出现降雪情况，各院系、各单位应立即组织人员进行清扫，我办不再另行通知。二、扫雪工作分工如下，请遵照执行：（一）鼓楼校区保卫处负责清扫北京西路主干道（上海路北口—鼓楼公园西端）；中美文化研究中心、海外教育学院负责清扫上海路北口—金银街路口；资产经营公司负责清扫西大门—北京西路、西大门—南秀村；后勤服务集团绿化养护与环卫中心负责清扫南、北园干道；后勤服务集团兰达物业公司负责清扫各学生宿舍至干道路面、广州路主干道（小粉桥路口—儿童医院）及汉口路（天津路口—青岛路口）；各院系、单位负责清扫各自门前积雪。（二）仙林校区后勤服务集团绿化养护与环卫中心负责清扫校区内主干道；后勤服务集团膳食中心负责清扫学生餐厅周边区域；后勤服务集团兰达物业公司负责清扫教学楼、基础实验楼、学生公寓等楼栋的周边区域（延伸至道路边）；保卫处负责清扫校门口；基建处安排人员清扫校区施工区域；各院系、单位负责清扫各自办公楼栋的周边区域（延伸至道路边）。（三）各院系、单位扫雪时要注意对树木的保护。校园内古树名木的雪中及雪后保护工作由后勤服务集团绿化养护与环卫中心负责。三、扫雪工具由后勤服务集团绿化养护与环卫中心（鼓楼校区电话：83592825，仙林校区电话：89682680）负责提供。四、请各院系、单位防患于未然，认真做好扫雪的准备与落实工作。对由于组织不力或玩忽职守造成不良后果的院系、单位和个人，学校将按南京市政府颁布的扫雪处罚规定追究责任。特此通知。    南京大学校长办公室2016年11月22日

title: Give
text:
About Us


Nanjing University Education Development Foundation (NJUEDF), registered at the Department of Civil Affairs of Jiangsu Province in 2005, is a nation-wide, non-public-offering foundation initiated by the university. Its working philosophy is mutual vision, mutual interest and mutual development. Its mission is: “shoulder the responsibility and promote the development.” It follows a path of development which is relevant to the conditions of the university and good for the growth of higher...




Why Giving


In the history of Nanjing University’s development, we have received great support both from governments of different levels and from society. To build ours into a “world-class university,” we need large amounts of financial support. Adequate funding is the primary guarantee for the reform and development of the university, and so generous support of colleagues and friends at home and abroad is greatly appreciated. 




Ways of Giving


The Nanjing University Education Development Foundation (NJUEDF) welcomes donations from all individuals who care about education. Various ways of making donations can be considered, ranging from small gifts to setting up of an endowment fund. The donation can be made in cash, checks, bank drafts, stocks and shares, securities, bonds, debentures, publications, software, facilities, real estates and other assets. Donors may choose to designate a specific purpose or use of the gift or simply...




Make a Gift Now!


Your generosity makes a difference in the lives of students, faculty, and the communities where they embody NJU's mission of building ours into a “world-class university,” serving the people and society, and contributing to the revitalization of China. Make a gift now!




Learn More


Read more about the Tax Exemption Policies.

title: Nanjing University
text: Founded in 1902, Nanjing University is one of the oldest and most prestigious institutions of higher learning in China. With the motto of 'Sincerity with Aspiration, Perseverance with Integrity,' this university carries the spirit of constant striving for educational and academic excellence…

title: Nanjing University
text:
Academician of the Chinese Academy of Sciences
President Chen Jun



Welcome  to Nanjing University
Located in the ancient capital of Nanjing, Nanjing University and its predecessors have taken responsibility for the country and the nation during its development of over 100 years. Committed to the prosperity of the nation and the advancement of science, Nanjing University makes significant contributions to the revitalization of China.Especially since the Reform and Opening-up, Nanjing University has seized this historic opportunity and gained vitality. Maintaining good momentum in teaching, research, social service as well as cultural inheritance and innovation, Nanjing University ranks among the top of China’s universities.Based on the principle of cultivating talents, Nanjing University has nurtured excellence for the nation during different historical stages. They have made remarkable contributions and achievements in different fields. Since the Reform and Opening-up, Nanjing University has made advancements in educational reform and developed many important theories of education and teaching, which are of significant effects on higher education at home and abroad. At present, Nanjing University is going on with reform of innovative talents training mechanism, and striving to cultivate leading and top-notch innovative talents equipped with creativity, practical ability and global perspective ready to lead the way in all sectors of society.The predecessor of Nanjing University was renowned for its scientific achievements. An emphasis on investigation and seeking truth have run through the history of its development and became the most important characteristic of this university. Generations of NJUers have worked diligently and made numerous excellent scientific achievements, gaining reputation in national and international academic circles. Guided by the principle of “carrying out fundamental research which leads the international academia, carrying out applied research which meets the national strategic demands and makes for economic development, and remaining committed to solving major theoretical and practical issues concerning national interest and people’s livelihood,” Nanjing University is striving to adjust the layout of scientific research, strengthen scientific research organizations, and comprehensively improve the ability and level of original research so as to develop Nanjing University into an important scientific research center in China.Since its establishment at the beginning of the last century, Nanjing University has been one of the most active universities in China in international communication and cooperation. It has established close collaborations with many first-class universities and high-level scientific research institutions around the world. Among them is the Johns Hopkins University-Nanjing University Center for Chinese and American Studies, which was established in the 1980s, has been successfully run for over 30 years. The program has produced many backbone talents for Sino-US relations and exerted a notable influence both at home and abroad. In this new age of international relations, Nanjing University is pushing ahead with wide-ranging and multiple international communication and cooperation projects in order to promote education internationalization.Nanjing University has now entered into its second hundred years of development. All NJUers will maintain a high spirit and a low profile to thoroughly carry out the instruction of “the First Nanjing University” proposed by President Xi Jinping. Focusing on connotative development and features of Nanjing University, let’s make arduous efforts to build NJU into a world-class university early and make greater contributions to the great rejuvenation of the Chinese nation!We thank you for your attention and look forward to your arrival! Let’s work together for a better future!

title: Nanjing University
text: Nanjing University is one of the top tier universities in China, and also one of the first to enroll international students in China. Nanjing University serves as the training site for diverse organizations as the Chinese Department of UN, the Council on International Education Exchange (CIEE)...

title: Overview
text: Overview of Graduate EducationNanjing University focuses its graduate education on the grand aim of building itself into a leading international university. It has decided on its guiding thought of nurturing innovation capacity and enhancing the quality of education comprehensibly. It will lay emphasis on system development and improvement. That is, it will let self-initiated research lead the way of the construction of interdisciplinary research platforms so as to enhance the innovative abilities of the graduate students. It will let international exchange lead the way of the construction of international academic exchange platforms so as to elevate the academic levels of the graduate students. It will also build platforms of excellent talents so as to improve the quality of graduate students education.Nanjing University has been actively promoting the internationalization of its graduate education and seeking new ways of student cultivation and collaborative research. It has established several institutions with overseas universities, such as the Johns Hopkins University-Nanjing University Center for Chinese and American Studies, the Sino-German Institute for Legal Studies and the Center for Sino-Japanese Cultural Studies. These institutions have cultivated many “backbone talents” for the cultural and educational development and thus have created great impact at home and abroad.The overall quality of graduate education of Nanjing University has improved in a steady pace and has made satisfying achievements. The university’s Graduate School has successively won the first prizes in Jiangsu Province Higher Education Teaching Achievement Award in 2000, 2004, 2007 and 2011. In the tenth anniversary after the issuing of the Regulations of the People's Republic of China on Academic Degrees, 20 graduates from Nanjing University were granted the title “Chinese Doctoral and Master's Degree Recipients who Made Outstanding Contributions in Work” by the State Council and Ministry of Education. Forty-four Ph.D. dissertations have been awarded the title the National Excellent Doctoral Dissertation, and 56 Ph.D. dissertations have been nominated for this title. In addition, 25 teaching textbooks by the university faculty have been recommended as the National Graduate Student Textbooks by the Ministry of Education and Office of the Academic Degrees Committee of the State Council.The graduate students from Nanjing University, with their high academic quality, innovation ability and fine professional training, are praised by their employers. They are playing key roles in universities, research institutions and enterprises, making contributions to the prosperity and scientific and technological development of our country. Some of them are now excellent scientists, technological workers, engineers, and economic managers.Nanjing University will continue to explore new ways and new modes of nurturing high-level quality talents. Aimed at achieving its goal of establishing a world-class university, it will implement its every policy and do its best about its graduate education.For details contactGraduate School of Nanjing University, No. 163 of Xianlin Avenue, Qixia District, Nanjing, China 210023
