title: The State Key Laboratory of Solid State Microstructures
text: The State Key Laboratory of Solid State MicrostructuresThe National Laboratory of Solid State Microstructures, Nanjing University, was set up in 1984 as one of the first state key laboratories in China. As a multidisciplinary science and engineering research center, NLSSM is aimed at making new artificial micro-structured materials through the design and tailoring of the energy band structures in reciprocal space, finding new macroscopic and microscopic quantum effects and principles, developing new theories and methodology based on quantum physics, and endeavoring to meet the scientific challenges and technological requirements encountered in the post-Moore era and the post-petroleum era. With Professor Xing Dingyu as the director of the academic committee and Professor Wang Mu as the director of the laboratory, NLSSM has a faculty of 48, including 8 academicians of the Chinese Academy of Sciences, 15 special professors of “Cheung Kong Scholars Program,” and 15 professors receiving the National Science Fund for Distinguished Young Scholars. In 1994, the faculty published the first paper in Nature about the mechanisms of the interfacial growth and this was a breakthrough for publishing papers in the highest quality academic journals. Later, a set of papers about dielectric superlattice were published in high quality international journals, including three papers in Science. In all the assessments of state key laboratories, NLSSM was regarded as an excellent laboratory and was ranked first in a group of mathematics and physics laboratories in 2000. In 1997, the journal Nature announced that NLSSM was one of the institutes in the Pacific rim of Asia (excluding Japan) approaching world-class standards in research [Nature 389, 113 (1997)]. As one of the major research centers in the field of condensed matter physics in China, NLSSM carried out researches projects on various sub-fields: artificial microstructure physics, quantum physics and the associated electronics, nanostructure properties and devices, soft condensed matter physics and computational physics. These research efforts are funded by several national, provincial and ministerial research funds, including 6 projects by the National Basic Research Program of China (973 Program), 15 sub-projects of the 973 Program, 4 projects of the National High-Tech R&D Program of China, 7 projects of the Key Program of National Natural Science Fund of China and so on. Since 2002, NLSSM’s faculty members have won the first prize of the National Natural Science once and the second prize of the National Natural Science 6 times. Currently, 27 project leaders and their teams are working in the Cyrus Tang Building with a total laboratory space of over 20,000 m2. The major state-of-the-art facilities at NLSSM include field-emission transmission electron microscope (Philips F20), spin-resolved ultrahigh vacuum scanning tunneling microscopy (Omicron), field-emission scanning electronic microscope (LEO 1530VP), solid state nuclear magnetic resonance system (Bruker Arance 300), and superconducting quantum interference device (SQUID) (MPMSXL-7). In addition, there are thin film/bulk material fabrication facilities and structural and spectrum characterization facilities. An advanced nanofabrication center, equipped with electron beam lithography system (Raith e-Line) and focusing ion-beam fabrication facility (Philips FB201), has been established, which will serve the needs for fabrications of nano/micro sized structures. Moreover, the supporting facilities include the super-computer system and low temperature workshop for providing liquid helium and liquid nitrogen. Between 2005 and 2009, the laboratory published 1,858 peer-reviewed research papers, of which 39 were in Physical Review Letters, 209 in Physical Review Series, and 178 in Applied Physics Letters. During this period, the number of authorized patents reached 90, 86 new applications in pending. NLSSM serves as a platform for international exchange and cooperation. It has accommodated many internship students, post-doctoral research associates and visitors from at home and abroad. It has collaboration agreements with research institutes and universities in USA, Japan, France, Germany, Italy and others. In collaboration with colleagues overseas, its faculty has published many joint research papers in Science, Nature Photonics, Advanced Materials, and Physical Review Letters. NLSSM sincerely welcomes international cooperation in areas of material design, quantum physics, nanooptics and plasmonics, clean energy and environment-related studies.Website of the laboratory.

title: Jiangsu Provincial Key laboratory of coastal zone and islands development
text: Jiangsu Provincial Key laboratory of coastal zone and islands development  The Jiangsu Provincial key laboratory of coastal zone and islands development focuses on the study of coastal zones. The laboratory has a multi-disciplinary based research center, involving subjects of oceanography, geology, geography, chemistry, biology, information technology and constructive planning. The laboratory is dedicated to studies of coastal zones, islands, resources around shallow continental shelf, and researches of ocean environment and ecology. It also aims to explore natural laws of coastal and oceanic evolvement under the background of global changes and helps constructive planning and decision making as well as do experiments of exploring resources and predicting natural disasters.   There are a group of outstanding experts and researchers in the laboratory including an academician of Chinese Academy of science, three “Yangtze River” scholars, two obtainers of national outstanding youth funds, one winner of Education Ministry’s New Century Excellent Talents Supporting Plan, 13 professors, 10 assistant professors and 12 technicians. The laboratory is based on nation-level key discipline of physical geography and province-level key discipline of oceanic geology and center of national talents of sciences.   The laboratory makes full use of the key disciplines of Nanjing University and carries out original researches in areas mentioned in the national medium and long-range program including study of fundamental science, scientific study of energy, resources and the ocean, study of ecology, environment protection and eco-efficient economy, meeting the demands of resources exploitation and environment protection during the process of building a moderately-prosperous society and achieving moderate modernization by the middle of this century. The laboratory aims to provide technological support related to exploitation of coastal and island resources, water resource, harbor resource, biological resources, and ecological improvement for the social and economic development of Jiangsu Province, increasing Jiangsu Province’s proportion of marine economic development in the country’ whole economic development.   The laboratory does experiments in coastal sedimentary system, coastal interaction of ocean-continent-atmosphere, ecological evolvement of coastal zone and island, coastal hydrologic cycle, cainozoic environmental changes East-Asian climate changes and regional responses of environmental changes. It also does researches in the protection of national interests, construction of key harbors, ecologic improvement of coastal zones, sustainable development of marine territory and biological resources, coastal city planning, coastal zone development and management technologies. We are devoted to the building of first-class marine laboratories, the education of talents with high capacity of innovation and the building of advanced data acquisition and analysis systems, improving Jiangsu Province’s competitiveness in the area of sustainable development and marine economy.

title: Jiangsu Provincial Key Laboratory of Vehicle Emissions Control
text: Jiangsu Provincial Key Laboratory of Vehicle Emissions Control  Jiangsu Provincial Key Laboratory of Vehicle Emissions Control is established based on the cooperation between Nanjing University and local enterprises. In June 2010, the laboratory was designed and constructed with the help of multi-disciplinary centers of Center of Modern Analysis, Nanjing University and catalytic cleaner company of Wuxi Weifu High-Technology Group Co., Ltd, which was completed and received its certificate from Jiangsu Province in December 2013. In 2014, the laboratory passed the test for Province-level key laboratory with good grades and received scientific funds of ¥2,000,000/ year for three years. The laboratory now has 50 researchers and 10 visiting experts. Among them, there are two academicians of Chinese Academy of Engineering, one from the “project of thousand youth talents”, and four from the “333 provincial project”. The present supervisor of this academic group is academician Zhang Guocheng, with two associate supervisors, professor Lu Guanzhong and Professor Dong Lin. Professor Dong Lin is the present director of the laboratory.  The laboratory aims to reduce exhaust gas emissions and improve quality of the environment. The laboratory is dedicated to developing highly efficient catalysts for pollutants in atmosphere, in exploring new techniques and approaches by doing researches in measures against mobile and stationary pollution sources, and measures controlling gas emissions in the atmosphere.  In terms of measures against mobile pollutant sources, the laboratory carries out studies in material as new catalysts and in the catalytic theory of its efficiency by analyzing the chemical reactions during the catalysis, which eventually leads to the development of high-efficient catalysts that can operate in harsh conditions. The lab plans to create high-efficient catalysts with multi functions by carefully studying the design, preparation, and characterizations of the catalysts, understanding the “component-structure-function” relationship of the catalytic materials. The lab, in the meanwhile, also focuses on the abatement of pollutants produced by new sources of energy for automobiles as well as the reinforcement of necessary equipment.  As for measures against stationary pollutants, such as emissions of NOx, CO2 and VOCs from coal-fired power plants, chemical plants and refuse landfills, the lab plans to carry out fundamental studies to develop high-efficient catalysts, and provide theoretical support for the design and development of relative catalysts by exploring the mechanisms of the catalytic reactions.  In terms of measures controlling emissions in the atmosphere, the lab tries to work out comprehensive measures including the design of new catalysts, coating machine, catalytic converter, desulfurization technology, and the design of urea dosing system.The laboratory has taken charge of / taken part in three projects from the national “973 program”, 8 projects from the national “863 program”, 2 projects from national natural science foundation of China's major scientific equipment development, over 10 projects from the general program, and other projects. More than 200 academic papers have been published, including over 60 SCI papers. The lab has applied for over 50 patents, among which more than 10 were authorized. The lab takes part in making one national standards and designs 3 new products. The lab has obtained 2 Second Class Prizes of the State Scientific and Technological Progress Award, and 1 Third Class Prize of the Jiangsu Scientific and Technological Award.  The laboratory is equipped with all kinds of advanced equipment and can give access to around 5-10 research studies every year and accept 10 visiting professors/ researchers each year. Website of the laboratory.

title: Jiangsu Provincial Key Laboratory of Data Engineering and Knowledge Service
text: Jiangsu Provincial Key Laboratory of Data Engineering and Knowledge Service  The laboratory was established in 2014 by the joint efforts of Nanjing University and Jiangsu Institute of Science and Technology Information.  It was built on the basis of Nanjing University’s institute of information technology development, which was established in 1994 and focused on the research and software development for information management and knowledge service, information processing and retrieval, and information analysis and scientific assessment. In these areas, it yielded outstanding results and social impact. The current laboratory and its predecessor both emphasize the research and teaching of modern technology relevant to the management of information resources, keep absorbing the latest achievements in information technology, apply the data mining theory and technology to the processing of information resources, utilize mathematic theories, hypertext technology and artificial intelligence in the research of information retrieval computing, and carry out multi-dimensional processing of citation indexes by adopting Chinese Social Sciences citation indexes established upon databases and introducing online analytical processing.  The achievements of the laboratory:It has taken charge of over 10 major national social science biding projects, projects of the National Natural Science Fund, projects of the National Social Science Fund, and provincial level and enterprise projects.It has published over 400 papers on academic journals at home and abroad, including over 70 published on first-rate national and international journals (cited by SCI, EI, and ISTP).It has published over 10 books.It has won many awards from the Ministry of Education, Jiangsu Philosophy and Social Sciences, and Nanjing University.  The director of the laboratory is Professor Ye Ying (Fred Y. Ye), who works in School of Information Management, Nanjing University. He is a fellow of the European Academy of Sciences and Arts.   The director of the academic committee of the laboratory, its academic leader, is Professor Su Xinning, who also works in School of Information Management, Nanjing University. He is a winner of the title of the Ministry-of-Education Cheung Kong Scholar.   The laboratory has a full-time or part-time faculty of nearly 50 people. Its major research areas include data integration and planning, knowledge correlation technology, data analysis theories and knowledge service technology in the context of big data, with the highest priority given to the last research areas.   In cooperation with relevant enterprises and public institutions, the laboratory will establish a demonstrative platform for data, technology and service, facilitating transformation and promotion of related applications and technology.  As an open laboratory, the Key Laboratory of Data Engineering and Knowledge Services will also provide data and equipment platforms every year, setting up open topics for scholars from at home and abroad to participate in the studies of data engineering and knowledge service.  The laboratory is committed to putting its strengths into full play, studying cutting-edge issues of information science, and enhancing its scientific research quality. On the one hand, it is going to increase the quantity and quality of its research results. On the other hand, it will continue to cultivate more qualified and capable professionals and talents with a broad and solid professional foundation in information technology who can meet social demands for talents. It will work to build itself into a scientific research institution that integrates industry, university and research. Website of the lab.

title: Collaborative Innovation Center of Novel Software Technology and Industrialization
text: Collaborative Innovation Center of Novel Software Technology and IndustrializationThe Collaborative Innovation Center of Novel Software Technology and Industrialization was established in December 2012. In April 2014, it was approved by the Educational Department of Jiangsu Province as a provincial-level collaborative innovation center in university and was given a four-year grant of 20 million yuan RMB. Focusing on meeting the major needs of Jiangsu’s software industry development, the center explores a system of collaborative innovation and research, develops long-term mechanisms of cooperation in production, education and research, and offers a public service platform that supports the promotion of innovation capacity of the software industry. The coordinated research focuses on the layout of forward-looking technology, key technology, and the enhancement of the quality of target products. It realizes open-ended aggregation of innovation resources, multi-discipline integration of talents cultivation, and multiple team collaboration and technological integration in product development. It strives to promote the innovation capacity of both universities and corporations and to push ahead with sustainable.The center has integrated the best resources from universities and corporations in Jiangsu Province, including Nanjing University, Southeast University, Nanjing University of Aeronautics and Astronautics, Soochow University, Nanjing Research Institute of Electronic Engineering (ENRIEE), Linkage Group Corporation, NARI Technology Co., Ltd., Nanjing LES Information Technology Co., Ltd. Focus Technology Co., Ltd., and Datcent Technology Co., Ltd. The center has integrated the platforms of State Key Laboratories, Chinese National Engineering Research Center, the Ministry-of-Education Key Laboratories, Key Laboratories of Jiangsu Province and Key Laboratories of Science and Technology for National Defense. It is now supporting over 40 enterprises, including software enterprises ranking among the top 10 in China, key state software enterprises, key high-tech enterprises of the National Torch Program and key enterprises in software bases supported by the National Torch Program.The center has made achievements in its exploration of a number of important issues such as how to overcome the barriers between “science and technology,” between “technology and industry” and between “crossover and collaboration,” how to realize the integration of “research, talents and disciplines” as well as “technology, talents and products,” and how to implement the development mode of “dual structure of disciplinary development,” “one school, two systems” and “multiple cultivating modes.” With the work of the center, six new “enterprise research institutes” came into being whereby universities work closely with enterprises, forming a network of collaborative innovation, combining core technology of university institutes with product development, upgrading and application by software enterprises and application units. The center has undertaken over 200 projects commissioned by the state and enterprises, published over 200 high-quality academic papers, and won 2 national-level and 11 provincial- and ministerial-level science and technology awards. It has presided 17 national and international academic conferences, held nearly 100 academic industrial forums, applied for over 400 patents for invention and over 300 software copyrights and invented over 10 new and high-tech products. It also provides consultancy services on information construction strategies and planning for provincial and municipal governments and for electric power and telecom industries, bringing significant economic and social benefits.

title: Jiangsu Provincial Engineering and Technology Research Center for Surface and Interface Chemistry
text: Jiangsu Provincial Engineering and Technology Research Center for Surface and Interface Chemistry  Jiangsu Provincial Engineering and Technology Research Center for Surface and Interface Chemistry was established in October 1998. By relying on the resources of Nanjing University, it is building itself into Jiangsu Provincial Interface Chemistry Engineering Technology Center,” which was rated in June 2000 as a provincial-level engineering construction research center by the Science and Technology Department of Jiangsu Province.  The center has two research institutions affiliated with it, “the Interface Science and Engineering Committee of China Institute of Composite Materials” and “the Institute of Coal Water Slurry Additives of the National Research Center of Coal Water Slurry Engineering Technology.”   The director of the center is currently Professor Shen Jian. On its faculty are 2 doctoral dissertation supervisors, 4 professors and 5 associate professors. They constitute a team of engineering technology with high capacity for research development and application.  The center conducts research on the theory and application of surface and interface chemistry in order to meet the needs of national economic construction, and its work is strengthened by the technological and human resources of Nanjing University. It is devoted to developing fine chemicals and functional polymer composites,researching on interface chemistry of multicomponent heterogeneous systems, new polymer surface active agent and advanced surface and interface chemical engineering technology which helps improve resource utilization and protect the environment, and developing new materials is conducted while common technology and key technology related are provided.   The center has made achieved great fruit in the production of new conductive polymer/carbon nano-composite materials. The capacitance of the 1M KCl electrolyte has reached 276.3 F g-1, which is 4 times higher than that of pure carbon nanotubes. This result has been published in Communications, Journal of Materials Chemistry A and other journals. It is widely received for it has good application prospects.   The center has successfully developed a new anticoagulant and biocompatible materials with independent intellectual property rights -- zwitterionic materials. It can greatly improve the anticoagulation and biocompatibility of various diagnostic and therapeutic devices contacting blood, and it will enjoy broad application prospects in the biological materials and medical device industry in China.  The center implements a one-stop operating mechanism including basic research application, product development research, test expanding, technological achievements transfer or industrialization. Driven by the market, the center has developed a number of high-level technology and products with high value to meet the market demand. A number of technology achievements have been successfully transferred to be implemented by enterprises, adding billions of yuan in the enterprises’ production values.   The center enjoys high reputation in the clean coal technology, especially in the preparation and application of coal-water slurry. The coal-water slurry additives NDF with the Chinese intellectual property rights was identified by the Ministry of Education as having generally reached the international advanced level and was considered the best coal-water slurry additive in China. The products, listed in the national Torch Program and the National Key New Products, have been widely used in the largest coal-water slurry pressurized gasification plant in China, the national coal-water slurry combustion demonstration projects and petrochemical, coal and other industries.  Since its establishment, the center has published over 200 research papers, including those in Chemical Reviews (published in 2008, in 2014 IF=46), and obtained over 40 national invention patent grants. It has undertaken 2 national “973 Program” projects, 1 “863 Program” project and a number of national, provincial and municipal science and technology projects. It has accomplished over 20 projects commissioned by enterprises, of which 2 are funded by the Program of Transformation of Scientific and Technological Achievements in Jiangsu Province.   The students under the guidance of the center’s faculty have won 4 gold awards of the “Challenge Cup” National College Student Business Plan Competition, 2 first prizes of “Challenge Cup” National College Student Extra-Curricular Academic Science and Technology Works Competition.   The center has won 8 provincial and ministerial level awards, including 1 first prize of natural science of the National Science & Technology Award nominated by the Ministry of Education and 1 first prize of Jiangsu Provincial Science and Technology Progress Award.

title: Jiangsu Historical and Cultural Research Base
text: Jiangsu Historical and Cultural Research BaseJiangsu Historical and Cultural Research Base was founded in November 2011. It is one of the Policy-Making Consultation Research Bases approved by Jiangsu Provincial People’s Government. The base is located in Nanjing University, and its chief expert is Professor He Yun’ao, director of the Cultural and Natural Heritage Research Institute of Nanjing University.  The base has a strong research team with rich experience in decision-making advisory research, open research mechanisms, and complete databases so that it carries out longitudinal studies on overall, strategic and policy-related issues concerning Jiangsu’s cultural heritage protection and development. It provides relevant departments of the province with efficient, professional, timely research and consulting services. The base has become a think-tank institution for governmental policy-making consultation in the fields of Jiangsu’s history and cultural research, protection and using of cultural heritage. Several of its achievements have been incorporated into the decision-making system of relevant departments of the provincial government.

title: Collaborative Innovation Center of South China Sea Studies
text: Collaborative Innovation Center of South China Sea StudiesThe Collaborative Innovation Center of South China Sea Studies at Nanjing University was founded in July 2012. In May 2013, it became one of the first collaborative innovation centers sponsored by the Ministry of Education and the Ministry of Finance.  The center was initiated by Nanjing University and has been greatly supported by the State Ministry of Foreign Affairs, the People’s Government of Hainan Province, and the State Oceanic Administration. It works in close collaboration with other research institutions, including the National Institute of South China Sea Studies, the Naval Command Academy, and Renmin University of China. Driven by the demands of major national policies and aimed at the defense of China’s maritime rights and security, the center seeks to develop basic research as well as research on applicable countermeasures on South China Sea issues, offers services to the nation’s strategic decision-making on these issues, and provides intellectual support for the nation’s development of “maritime power,” mainly through collaborative innovation between disciplines and institutes—namely, between Arts and Sciences, military and civilian organizations, universities and institutes, and between universities—which is enabled by system and mechanism innovation.  The center edits and publishes an academic journal Asia-Pacific Security and Maritime Affairs, which has become a representative academic frontier for the study of maritime security in China. In addition, the center, by organizing and publishing The South China Sea Papers and Research Reports on South China Sea Strategies, monitors the latest developments in the South China Sea situation and offers information to experts in the field. It has become a representative think tank in disseminating and communicating China’s South China Sea policies.    Contact Tel:  +86-25-83597212Email:  nanhai@nju.edu.cn

title: 公告通知
校长办公室关于2016年元旦放假的通知
text:
公告通知
                            

当前位置：首页  南大新闻  公告通知






                                校长办公室关于2016年元旦放假的通知
                            

时间：2015-12-21浏览：5648



各院系、各单位：根据国务院办公厅通知精神，经研究决定，2016年元旦1月1日（星期五）放假一天，1月2日（星期六）、1月3日（星期日）正常休息。后勤部门和产业单位的放假时间可自行安排。各院系、各单位要在元旦放假前对本单位进行一次全面的安全检查，消除安全隐患，并切实做好节日（1月1日）的值班安排和安全保卫工作。各院系要在12月31日前对学生进行一次安全教育，并掌握元旦期间离校外出学生的去向。请各院系、各单位将节日值班名单于12月31日前报送校长办公室。特此通知，请遵照执行。南京大学校长办公室2015年12月17日

title: 北京理工大学党委学生工作部来我校调研交流
text:
北京理工大学党委学生工作部来我校调研交流
                    
发布时间：2016-10-31浏览次数：10



北京理工大学党委学生工作部来我校调研交流10月21日，北京理工大学党委学生工作部副部长徐贵宝一行来我校就学生网络思想政治教育工作和辅导员队伍建设开展调研，我校党委学生工作部、党委研究生工作部、现代工程与应用科学学院、数学系等单位代表参加交流。交流会上，党委学生工作部副部长蒋恩铭代表学校对徐贵宝副部长一行的来访表示欢迎。与会来宾通过南京大学宣传片全面了解了我校的历史及在教学科研、人才培养、社会服务等方面取得的突出成绩。徐贵宝副部长回顾了北京理工大学校史，基于两校的渊源和良好的交流传统，并希望两校今后能在学工队伍建设、优秀人才培养方面增进对话、相互启发。双方分别就网络思政教育、辅导员队伍培训及考核管理、辅导员后备人员的培育选拔、学业指导工作开展情况、研究生管理措施等方面进行了交流与研讨。

title: 王志林副校长与辅导员谈拔尖创新人才培养
text:
王志林副校长与辅导员谈拔尖创新人才培养
                    
发布时间：2016-10-27浏览次数：10



王志林副校长与辅导员谈拔尖创新人才培养10月27日上午，辅导员专题培训会在仙林校区南青报告厅举行。南京大学副校长王志林就“拔尖创新人才培养的思考与实践——以南京大学为例”做报告，党委学生工作部负责人、全体本科生和研究生辅导员参加培训。培训会由党委学生工作部部长龚跃主持。培训中，王志林副校长借用钱学森之问，并结合南京大学人才培养中遇到的具体问题，指出南京大学作为中国一流大学务必要加强拔尖创新人才的培育，一方面要加强对拔尖创新人才培养的重要性的认识，另一方面要积极探索拔尖创新人才培养的成功模式。通过对李约瑟难题的要点解读，强调了辅导员在进行学业指导工作时要注重学生创新精神的培养，要积极配合教学老师的工作。他提出，现代高等教育要注重培养学生以下四种能力：学会认知，学会做事，学会合作，学会生存。尤其强调，学会生存的内涵指的是培养学生适应形势的变革变化的能力，这即是教育的本源。在王志林副校长分享了多所世界名校的校训后，提出南京大学作为全国一流大学，应当为国家培养出更多具有独立性和创新性的人才，推动社会发展，引领世界进步。王志林副校长从南京大学人才培养理念和人才培养模式的历史沿革出发，向各位辅导员介绍了南京大学大理科实验班、基础学科人才培养基地、多学科拔尖计划、匡亚明学院强化班等培养计划，强调了高等学校的建设主要在于高水平人才的培养。他强调，南京大学三三制人才培养机制的改革创新将会大力推动南京大学拔尖创新人才培养的进程。党委学生工作部龚跃部长做总结发言，他提出本次培训旨在指导各院系辅导员提高对南京大学拔尖创新人才培养重要性的认识，希望各位辅导员能够紧紧围绕人才工作开展思政教育，深入思考辅导员的工作理念，提高个人素质和改善精神面貌，协力南京大学拔尖创新人才培养工作。根据学校党委的工作要求，党委学生工作部将进一步优化工作机制，强化辅导员专题培训，明确工作责任，使南京大学的学生工作上一个新台阶。（党委学工部）

title: 【两学一做专题】地理学院本科毕业班支部“听党史，学党章”党日活动
text:
【两学一做专题】地理学院本科毕业班支部“听党史，学党章”党日活动
                    
发布时间：2016-06-13浏览次数：12



【地理】“走进梅园新村纪念馆”——本科毕业班支部“听党史，学党章”党日活动为传达学习贯彻学校“两学一做”教育专题会议精神，5月31日下午，地理与海洋科学学院本科毕业班党支部在南大仙林校区昆山楼B237会议室开展了主题为“走进梅园新村纪念馆”——“听党史，学党章”交流分享的党日活动。支部全体党员参加了本次活动。  “两学一做”学习教育即“学党章党规，学系列讲话，做合格党员”。本次党日活动以“听党史”、“学习党章”为切入点，在活动前期，支部党员被分成几个小组，共同学习党章和习近平总书记系列讲话，摘录经典内容并撰写学习心得，在活动中进行分享。活动当天，我支部邀请到中共代表团梅园新村纪念馆的张舒文老师，为我们讲述1946年5月至1947年3月以周恩来为首的中国共产党代表团在梅园新村同国民党政府进行10个月零4天的谈判这一段历史，并放映《风范》视频。正如纪念馆门前的周恩来铜像表现出他坚定、沉着、机智的革命家形象，作为一名中共党员，坚定、沉着、机智、从容的精神品质亦是不可缺少的，周恩来总理时时刻刻以人民为重，这不正是“全心全意为人民服务”的宗旨的体现吗？党员前辈遵守党纪党规，保持优良作风，坚决践行党中央的决策指示；身处斗争中心，心怀坚定的信仰，为党和人民的利益不懈努力，真正达到一个优秀共产党员的要求。黄宏鸣同学以习近平总书记在全国宗教会议上的讲话为学习材料，介绍党的宗教工作的基本方针：全面贯彻党的宗教信仰自由政策、依法管理宗教事务、坚持独立自主自办原则、积极引导宗教与社会主义社会相适应。他详细解读了这4个方针政策，讲述了一些有关宗教亲身经历，并提出了自己的在宗教问题上的看法：宗教与民族不可混淆，党员同志要不断反思自己在思想上入党的彻底性，警惕极端宗教势力对基层党组织的渗透。之后，支部其他党员根据自己的学习心得踊跃发言、积极讨论，在交流分享的过程中，对学习内容有了更深入的认识。最后，支部书记李岩老师对本次交流活动进行了总结，肯定了同学们的学习成果，也对支部党员们日后的发展表达了殷切期望。本次党日活动以全员参与、贴近实际的方式，完成了“两学一做”的学习向广大党员拓展、向经常性教育延伸的目标，并教育和鼓励支部党员坚定信念，提高党政意识，增强党性修养，从思想和行动上做一名合格党员。

title: 2016奖学金公示（一）
text: 经个人申请、院系推荐、学校组织审核，拟评定尤齐星等同学获得杜厦奖学金等奖学金项目，现予以公示（具体名单附后）。     公示时间：2016年11月7日至11月11日。公示期间，如有异议，请向学校学生工作处以书面形式反映。联系人:学生工作处王老师（89680606，wangsy@nju.du.cn）。附件: 9月18日，2016级本科新生座谈会在行政北楼128会议室召开，我校党委学工部负责人出席座谈会，并与各院系新生代表展开交流。党委学工部副部长蒋恩铭主持座谈会。现场本次会议的主题是以一个全新的大学生身份谈对开学入学教育的理解和建议。来自28个院系的新生代表齐聚一堂，就陈骏校长的讲话、张异宾书记的开学第一课以及新生入学教育系列讲座各抒己见。与会新生进行了热烈的讨论与交流，分别讲述了对于南京大学的情感，对于校训的理解以及初入大学多天以来的精神体悟和认知。陈校长讲话中对于南大学子的希冀，“钟山之崇高，大江之雄毅，玄武之深静，雨花之斑斓”在各位学子心中留下了深刻的印象并激起共鸣，大家纷纷阐述了自己独到的见解。来自工程管理学院的程臻同学将四个关键词分别具体化，号召青年学子充满力量的实现理想，注重个性化发展；来自文学院的顾阅微同学强调守护心中深静的气质，应当“保持沉静支持，做物欲的旁观者”并呼吁捧回纸质书。各院系新生代表不仅心存伟大，志存高远，更对未来有着切实的规划和务实的想法：来自大气科学院的孔畅同学从时间安排、团队合作等角度分享了实现伟大的具体做法；来自软件学院的何天行同学说，“创新的基础在于实践，创业的动力源于学习”，表达了新同学从专业特色出发描绘自己的“双创”蓝图。在陈骏校长、张异宾书记讲话的感召之下，新生代表们更是抒发了心中澎湃的爱国热情和家国情怀，表现出对社会责任、历史使命、南大未来的担当。随后，各院系新生代表分享了对待学业的情怀与态度：来自社会学院的张舜杰通过身边故事表明我们应该心怀真诚，敬畏；来自法学院的刘星池同学表示“我们不应由于囿于单一领域”。这些都使同学们受益匪浅，并对南大的独特政策十分感激与珍惜。经过两小时的热烈讨论，大家的思想碰撞融合，虽然语言表达各不相同，但发出了统一的心声——共同为南大办中国最好本科教育的事业添砖加瓦。党委学工部部长龚跃在总结发言中指出，今日大家清澈的目光令他印象深刻，各位同学的发言恰恰回答了何为初心的问题，呼应了张书记“铸就灿烂初心”的开学第一课。“最好与伟大是静态的，源自他人的评价，而努力是一种动态的精神状态，反映一种追求的过程”，龚跃部长如是说，这也是他对全体2016级新生的期望，同时，他建议28位代表成立“伟大学社”社团，为同学更好的成长成才提供服务。据悉，此次座谈会作为新生入学教育系列活动之一，旨在了解新生对于系列讲座的体悟与认知，也为新生吐露心声、表达观点、提出想法提供渠道，为更好地开展大学生思政工作建言献策。（党委学工部）

title: [工管院]学生给父母寄明信片表达感恩
text:
[工管院]学生给父母寄明信片表达感恩
                    
发布时间：2016-02-26浏览次数：35



“家文化”主题活动是我校工程管理学院师生广泛参与的一项传统活动，也成为该院的一个文化特色。2016年1月初，学院团委、研究生会、班委会联合组织开展“你陪我长大，我伴你变老”的父母生日寄送明信片活动。活动前，同学们围绕活动主题和学院特色设计制作了六款精美明信片。班委根据提前收集到的所有同学父母的生日信息，提前一周将制作好的明信片附上邮票送给父母要过生日的同学。然后，同学们会认真写上对父母的生日祝福，并寄送给他们。诚挚的话语中流露出对父母的感谢和对自己的激励。据悉，该活动已经举办了四年，全院教职工也参与其中。大家都认为，传统的明信片是现代人回归纯朴真情的方式之一，亲手写的明信片表达对父母的感恩之情，更真情实意。收到明信片的父母更是情不能已，看见明信片就好像见到了孩子。读着明信片上的一字一句，他们感到孩子真的是长大了。（工管院 陆雁翎）

title: Collaborative Innovation Center of Advanced Microstructures_Section of Student Exchange Programmes Office of International Cooperation and Exchanges
text:
Collaborative Innovation Center of Advanced Microstructures
Time:2015-08-08 13:29　Source:未知 Author:chenxiaoqing　
              Click: 
               


Where microstructures have macro impact
The Collaborative Innovation Center of Advanced Microstructures (CICAM), leading by Nanjing University, was established under the 2011 Plan, an initiative of the Chinese Ministry of Education and Ministry of Finance to develop the innovation capacity of universities across the country. The plan was introduced as an important strategic measure in China’s higher education system through the establishment of Collaborative Innovation Centers focused on four key categories: frontier science, industrial development, regional development and cultural heritage. In an evaluation by the Ministry of Education in early 2014, CICAM came out on top of all the Collaborative Innovation Centers evaluated this year.
 
CICAM concentrates on conducting interdisciplinary research on advanced and artificial microstructure materials where micro- to nano-scale features give rise to novel properties, which can be exploited for a range of technological applications. Researchers at CICAM conduct fundamental research on advanced and artificial microstructures and also work to translate their findings into relevant applications. Through these efforts CICAM aims to establish itself as a leading centre in the field, producing research that catalyses Chinese industry and meets their technology needs. The centre is also committed to training researchers and drawing prominent scientists from across the country to become a world-class scientific institution.
 
CICAM is the result of a partnership between several universities, research institutes and companies located in the Yangtze River Delta region, a thriving belt for science and education in China with a very active high-tech industry. The partner institutions have a long history of cooperation in large research projects and are committed to sharing the responsibilities and benefits of CICAM. Members of the CICAM partnership include Nanjing University, Fudan University, Zhejiang University, the University of Science and Technology of China, Shanghai Jiao Tong University, Hefei Institutes of Physical Science of the Chinese Academy of Sciences and Huawei Technologies.
 
The strength of collaborative innovation
CICAM’s collaborative approach has paid significant dividends. The centre takes advantage of the expertise cultivated in five established research platforms, including the National Laboratory of Solid State Microstructures at Nanjing University, to create an environment conducive to innovation on par with that achieved by the international community. 
 
CICAM is currently responsible for 60 major national research projects with a total research budget of RMB 380 million (approximately USD 62 million). Its research in the areas of dielectric superlattices and iron-based superconductors is among the strongest in the world. It has also yielded numerous important innovations in the areas of optics, acoustic diodes, quantum integrated chips, high-temperature superconducting materials and their mechanisms, quantum spin Hall systems, entangled edge states, nanophotovoltaics, all-solid-state laser microstructures and micro-nanofabrication technologies. For example, CICAM researchers have designed a semiconductor laser array chip based on artificial microstructures, which has entered into Huawei Technologies’ industrial exploration programme on photonic integrated devices in 2013.
 
CICAM has attracted the attention of the scientific community for the high quality of its research as well as for its implementation of novel and innovative training solutions for talented young scientists, such as through personalized training for top students. An eight-year programme at the centre covering undergraduate-, masters- and PhD-level study has proved very successful.
 
Overall, CICAM represents some of the best science conducted in China today. It is a dynamic centre for research and researcher development, exploring novel approaches to artificial microstructures and producing original research to meet the country’s core technology needs.
 

The Collaborative Innovation Center of Advanced Microstructures (CICAM) was formally authenticated by the Ministry of Education of China in 2014. Here, we discuss CICAM’s mission and development with three CICAM directors: Dingyu Xing of Nanjing University, Fuchun Zhang of Zhejiang University and Xingao Gong of Fudan University.
 
Who founded the centre?
Nanjing University took the lead in founding CICAM in 2012, in partnership with Fudan University and Shanghai Jiao Tong University (both in Shanghai), Zhejiang University (in Hangzhou), the University of Science and Technology of China and the Hefei Institutes of Physical Science of the Chinese Academy of Sciences (both in Hefei) and the company Huawei Technologies. The cities of Shanghai, Hefei and Hangzhou are all connected to Nanjing by high-speed railway and lie in the economically dynamic region of the Yangtze River Delta. The five universities are ranked in the top ten institutions for physics research in China and are especially strong in the areas of condensed-matter physics and materials sciences. CICAM brings together many important leaders in the field of artificial microstructures, including a Nobel laureate, a member of the American Academy of Engineering, 16 academicians of the Chinese Academy of Sciences, 34 Changjiang endowed professors and 45 Distinguished Young Scholars of the Natural Science Foundation of China.
 
Why was CICAM established?
Research and development into artificial microstructures lies at the forefront of modern physical science. As one of the most important and promising research areas in the 21st century, microstructures research is at the crossover of condensed-matter physics, materials science and information science. Designing and manufacturing artificial microstructures at various scales can reveal novel quantum effects, help advance science and technology for quantum manipulation and lead to new generations of materials, information and energy technologies. 
 
What advantages do collaborative innovation centres offer?
Collaborative innovation centres attract some of the most talented researchers. They also promote interdisciplinary research through bringing together researchers with expertise in different areas and sharing resources. CICAM will combine the research capabilities of the National Laboratory of Solid State Microstructures and the State Key Laboratory of Coordination Chemistry of Nanjing University, the High Magnetic Field Laboratory at the Hefei Institutes of Physical Science of the Chinese Academy of Sciences, the State Key Laboratory of Surface Physics of Fudan University, the Key Laboratory of Artificial Structures and Quantum Control of Shanghai Jiaotong University, the Center of Correlated Matter at Zhejiang University and Huawei Technologies’ Noah’s Ark Lab. In addition, CICAM receives support from five provincial key laboratories and 17 national researcher training centres.
 
What are the main research focuses of CICAM?
Focusing on cutting-edge science, CICAM chose artificial bandgap materials, correlated electron systems and small quantum systems as its three main innovation areas. It established eight cross-institutional innovation platforms: essential facilities for microstructure research, artificial bandgap- and meta-materials, micro/nano-photonics, quantum phase transitions and quantum manipulation for correlated electron materials, novel superconducting materials and unconventional mechanisms, mesoscopic physics and devices, magnetic nanostructures and spintronics, and functional microstructured devices and system integration. Huawei participates in the construction of the last platform, which is dedicated to converting the scientific achievements of CICAM into practical applications.
 
How does CICAM plan to attract talented researchers?
CICAM will follow international standards for hiring, in line with the Association of American Universities. The centre will coordinate across its different institutions, but will establish an independent management authority for establishing positions based on its research progress. The principal investigators will report directly to the centre’s directors. Employment at the centre will be contract based for the duration of the research projects and key researchers will receive international evaluation. CICAM will also provide many incentives to attract talented researchers, especially active young researchers. Once hired, researchers will receive generous non-competitive research funding from the centre.

title: State Key Laboratory of Solid State Microstructures_Section of Student Exchange Programmes Office of International Cooperation and Exchanges
text:
State Key Laboratory of Solid State Microstructures
Time:2015-08-07 12:43　Source:未知 Author:chenxiaoqing　
              Click: 
               


As one of the major labs approved and funded by the National Planning Commission of China in 1984, it was established and ratified in 1987. State Key Laboratory of Solid State Microstructures is divided into four divisions: observation of microstructures, spectroscopy and physical properties fabrication, tile study of new materials and condensed matter theory. They are composed of 17 research groups.
 
The lab covers researches on distribution, interaction, fabrication and transformation of microstruetures at different levels. Special attention is paid to the relationship between the microstructures and the physical properties. With the help of the experimental methods of state-of-art, various kinds of microstructured materials are designed and fabricated. The physical process and effects therein are investigated. New functional materials with expected microstructures and performance are designed and developed via various modern techniques.
 
The mission of the lab is to develop experimental techniques and methods of fabrication, observation and measurement of the microstructured materials, to study physics of defects and phase transition, and to establish theoretical methods and computing techniques of solid state microstructures. By revealing the links between microstructures of the materials and physical properties, it is expected to control the solid state microstructures , which can be used in their applications. At present the materials under investigation in NLSSMS include solid thin films, muhilayered films, nanosized and cluster materials, dielectric superlattice and semiconductor superlattiee, high Tc superconductors, liquid crystals, polymers, and colloids, etc.
 
The lab is always classed among the highest rank in every assessment of the State key labs undertaken by government agencies. It was mentioned by the world-famous scientific journal "Nature" as an institution in Asia(outside Japan) with research standard approaching world-class [ Nature, 389 (1997) 113 ].

title: State Key Laboratory of Pollution Control and Resource Reuse_Section of Student Exchange Programmes Office of International Cooperation and Exchanges
text:
State Key Laboratory of Pollution Control and Resource Reuse
Time:2015-08-07 12:41　Source:未知 Author:chenxiaoqing　
              Click: 
               


Relying on the research resources of environmental science & environmental engineering of Tongji University and Nanjing University, the State Key Laboratory of Pollution Control and Resource Reuse offers an important platform of research and teaching for 3 national key disciplines (including Environmental Engineering, Environmental Science and Municipal Engineering) and 7 Ph.D. programs. The laboratory, which was founded in 1991 with the approval of the State Planning Commission in 1989, formally commenced operation in 1995 after the national level acceptance. The Laboratory passed twice the national evaluation in 2000 and 2005. The Director of Laboratory’s Academic Committee is Professor Hao Jiming, Academician of CAE, and the director of the Laboratory is Professor Zhao Jianfu. Professor Li Aimin, Associate Director of the laboratory, presided over the work of Nanjing Branch Office.
 
Based on the strategic demands of the country, targeting the state-of-the-art science and technology, and guided by the National Long- and Medium-term Program of Sci-Tech Development Planning, the laboratory gives priority to the major common environmental pollution issues arising from the rapid economic development and urbanization process. Combining basic and applied researches in the field of pollution control and resource reuse, the laboratory has conducted extensive innovative and interdisciplinary research and has developed a series of pollution control and resource reuse technologies with independent intellectual properties in such fields as municipal wastewater advanced treatment, industrial wastewater management and reuse, domestic refuse disposal and reuse, environment restoration and watershed pollution control, etc. Nowadays, the laboratory has become a globally recognized environmental and technological innovation platform, international cooperation and exchange center as well as high-quality talent training center.

title: The MOE key Laboratory of Modern Acoustics_Section of Student Exchange Programmes Office of International Cooperation and Exchanges
text: Key Laboratory of Modern Acoustics in Nanjing University founded in 1954 has become a main acoustic college as a teaching and research base. It is the only laboratory that has undergraduates and the state acoustic key discipline. Currently it has a complete talent-training system from undergraduate to doctoral, post-doctoral at all levels of acoustic, covering the majority of basic and applied research on acoustic sound. The overall academic standards are among the best in the country, and it also enjoys a high academic reputation. As a key basic research acoustic laboratory and acoustic Talent Development base, our laboratory leads the development of world science and strengthens basic acoustic research. Meanwhile, the laboratory extends the scope of the practical application, meets the strategic needs of the country and makes a significant contribution to economy and society. There are five major research areas: 1) effects of ultrasound in medical life science applications; 2) New Materials Preparation and Characterization of ultrasound; 3) the physics of acoustic stealth technology and applications; 4) Audio and Video Information Processing technology; 5) complex structure characteristics of sound propagation. Close and fruitful international cooperation and exchange are the advantages of this laboratory: Ministry of Science and Technology cooperation on the EU commitment to special projects; participation in the Motorola's Global University Program, University of Western Australia's combination with successful applicants from National Natural Science Foundation of the "two bases" of overseas cooperation projects; joint application of University of Leuven, Belgium Ministry of Science and the scientific and technological cooperation projects in the Government of Belgium.

Study on New Optical Effect in Artificial Micro/Nano Structures
Time:2015-08-07 14:03　Source:未知 Author:chenxiaoqing　
              Click: 
               


Research Content:
This project aims to study the interaction between the light and the electron, exciton and other elementary excitations in micro/nano structures, to manipulate the photonic excitation and propagations beyond the diffraction limit, to explore the optical excitation, propagation and related coherence effect, and study of the new optical effects on quantum confined structures, as well as to provide a road map and foundations for implementation of all-optical and electro-optical hybrid functional material and micro/nano devices.

title: Controllable Construction and Func-tionalization of Some Specific Mes-oscopic Systems: Experimental and Theoretical Studies_Section of Student Exchange Programmes Office of International Cooperation and Exchanges
text:
Controllable Construction and Func-tionalization of Some Specific Mes-oscopic Systems: Experimental and Theoretical Studies
Time:2015-08-07 13:59　Source:未知 Author:chenxiaoqing　
              Click: 
               


Research Content:
 
Mesoscopy is the bridge connecting microscopy with macroscopy, which is a new field in today’s chemical research beyond the molecular frontier. This innovative research team, affiliated to the Key
 
Laboratory of Mesoscopic Chemistry of MOE, concentrates on the experimental and theoretical study on the growth mechanism, controllable construction and functionalization of some selected important mesoscopic systems in three aspects. 1) Quantum chemistry methods and molecular dynamics, as well as the structure-property correlations for mesoscopic systems. 2) Growth mechanism, compositional and structural regulation of typical nanotubes (e.g., carbon-based, oxide and amorphous alloy nanotubes) and one-dimensional group-III nitrides, as well as the controllable assembly of two-dimensional bionic membranes. 3) Energy-, environment- and bionic sensor-oriented functionalization.
 
In the past few years, some first-class results with worldwide influence have been achieved and most of which have been accomplished in connection with the performance of the related national key projects. The research team have gradually formed its own character in persistence on fundamental understand-ing, the openness to multiple viewpoints and disciplines, the tight coupling of theory and experiment, the application-oriented motivation and the discovery of new phenomena.

title: Quantum Effects and Their Manipula-tion in Low Dimensional Spin Systems_Section of Student Exchange Programmes Office of International Cooperation and Exchanges
text:
Quantum Effects and Their Manipula-tion in Low Dimensional Spin Systems
Time:2015-08-07 15:32　Source:未知 Author:chenxiaoqing　
              Click: 
               


Research Subject:
Quantum effect; Quantum manipulation; Spin system; Low dimensional system
 
Principal Investigator:
Prof. Haifeng DING
hfding@nju.edu.cn
 
Research Content & Progress:
This project mainly focuses on the following four topics: (1) To fabricate magnetic atomic chains/ clusters and their assembles and to study their size and structure dependent properties. (2) To prepare ferromganet/monolayer molecular /ferromagnet molecular junctions or ferromagnet-single molecular hybrid nanoparticles, and to study spin injection, transport and manipulation by changing the types of moleculars. (3) To prepare Ruddlesden-Poper series transitional metal oxide and to study their electronic and spin related properties through the variation of the dimension. (4) To complete theoretical design and to prepare lab-level prototype heterostructures,nanoribbon and nanoclusters etc. for spin related functional materials. This project is founded this year.

title: Semiconductor Functional Quantum Structure’s Function and Structure_Section of Student Exchange Programmes Office of International Cooperation and Exchanges
text:
Semiconductor Functional Quantum Structure’s Function and Structure
Time:2015-08-07 15:28　Source:未知 Author:chenxiaoqing　
              Click: 
               


Research Subject:
Semiconductor; Functional quantum structures
 
Principal Investigator:
Prof. Rong ZHANG
ndrzhang@nju.edu.cn
 
Research Content & Progress:
Aiming at the new rule and new effect of semiconductor functional quantum structure, we especially study dependence and variation regularity of semiconductor functional quantum structure’s function and structure, develop new structures, achieve new functions, and research new devices. It concretely include s five projects: (1) Regulation principle and device applications for band of wide bandgap semi-conductor induced by polarization, polarization properties of wide bandgap semiconductor, regulation principle and device realization for band of semiconductor functional quantum structure by polariza-tion; (2) Spin quantum structure and device of high curie temperature, origin for the ferromagnetism of wide bandgap diluted magnetic semiconductor, stable methods of getting high curie temperature diluted magnetic semiconductor, and spin quantum device; (3) Effect and regulation of semiconductor quantum structure spin splitting, internal connection of quantum confinement structure and spin splitting, effect of strain, and effects of band spin splitting such as spin photocurrent; (4) Functional coordination and device application of semiconductor composite quantum structure, preparing new semiconductor som-posite quantum structure, and investigating the functional coordination relation of composite quantum system; (5) Preparation and characterization of new type quantum dot nanostructure, investigating con-trollable growth and preparing of new type quantum dot structure such as sparse quantum dot and quan-tum dot molecule, studying the coupling effect of quantum dot electronic state and optical micro cavity.

title: An Extended Vertical HVPE System_Section of Student Exchange Programmes Office of International Cooperation and Exchanges
text:
An Extended Vertical HVPE System
Time:2015-08-07 15:26　Source:未知 Author:chenxiaoqing　
              Click: 
               


Principal Investigator:
Prof. Rong ZHANG
ndrzhang@nju.edu.cn
 
Research Content & Progress:
Based on the aim of designing extended vertical HVPE system, a new extended vertical HVPE system has been successfully fabricated. The design requirements have been reached after debugging. Many key problems were solved in the extended HVPE system. The condition and technology of self-peeling technology were investigated and optimized. Two inch free standing GaN thick film with good quality was obtained, which shows that we take the lead in successfully obtaining two-inch free-standing thick
 
GaN film in homeland. The achievement reaches the international advanced level.

title: School of Earth Sciences & Engineering
text:
Name: 
Prof. Xiaozhao LI


Title:
Professor


Affiliation:
Institute for Underground Space and Geo-environment (NJU-IUSG) School of Earth Sciences and Engineering
							


Email:
lixz@nju.edu.cn


Research Interests:
Engineering geology, Geotechnical engineering, Urban underground space, Geothermal utilization, Nuclear waste disposal, Characterization of rock fracture system

 
Xiaozhao Li is a professor of geological engineering at the School of Earth Sciences and Engineering, Nanjing University, the Director of Institute for Underground Space and Geo-environment at Nanjing University (NJU-IUSG), director of Nanjing Innovation Centre for Shallow Geothermal Development Industry (ICSGI).
 
He received his BEng, MEng and PhD degrees from the State Key Discipline for Geotechnical Engineering at China University of Mining and Technology (CUMT). He was a Postdoctoral researcher in the State Key Discipline for Hydrogeology and Engineering Geology at Nanjing University (1996-1998), a Visiting Professor at Nanyang Technological University in Singapore (2005, 2015), a Guest Professor in Institute of Applied Earth Sciences at Graz University of Technology in Austria (2008) and a Invited Visiting Professor in Laboratory of Engineering and Environmental Geology at Swiss Federal Institute of Technology in Lausanne (2011).
 
His current research focuses on: 1) Urban underground sustainable development: impacts of underground engineering on geological environment, mechanism of interaction between developments of different urban underground resources (space, water, energy and material) and methodology of sustainable urban underground development (e.g. Energy Geostructure); 2)Characterization and modeling of fractures at different scales; 3)Radioactive waste disposal: site investigation and characterization, design principle and construction methods for depository & Underground Research Laboratory (URL), etc.
 
His researches have been granted by National Key Basic Research Program of China (973 Program), Chinese National Science Foundations, also inter-governmental and internatioanl JRP program, such as Sino-Swiss Science and Technology Cooperation (SSSTC) and EU-FP7-Marie Curie IRSES. He has won 8 national awards, including the first prize for scientific and technological progress awarded by China Education Ministry in 2001, National Award for Youth Scientist in Geology in 2001 and “New Century Excellent Talents in University” awarded by China Education Ministry in 2004.
 
He is the author of more than 150 papers, has gained the Second Prize for Excellent Textbooks in China. He has been invited to deliver more than 30 keynotes and plenary lectures in academic conferences, served on about 30 scientific committees in national and international conferences. He has been also invited to deliver 9 lectures in universities and research organizations. 
 
He is active members of many academic societies, such as Member of Working Group 15-Underground and Environment of the International Tunnelling and Underground Space Association (ITA-AITES), Core member of International Geotechnical Safety Network (GEOSNet), Vice chair of Chinese Society for Underground Space, Vice chair of Waste Underground Disposal Committee of CSRME (China Society for Rock Mechanics and Engineering), Vice chair of China Society for Underground Space, Vice chair of Youth Committee of CSRME, Vice chair of Tunnel and Underground Works Risk Control Committee of China Civil Engineering Society. He is on the editorial boards of Chinese Journal of Rock Mechanics and Engineering, Chinese Journal of Underground Space and Engineering and Journal of Basic Science and Engineering.
 
He has also been invited as evaluation experts by many agencies, such as such as National Natural Science Foundation of China (NSFC), China Ministry of Science and Technology (MOST), China Ministry of Education (MOE) and China Academic Degrees & Graduate Education Development Centre (CDGDC). He has participated advisory and consulting works for large-scale engineering projects in different counties, e.g. he was appointed the chair of review panel for the geotechnical investigation of Hong Kong-Zhuhai-Macau Oversea Channel(including bridges, subsea tunnels and artifical island) which calls for a total investment of over 72 billion RMB. He is one of the main experts invited by central government and stakeholders on Chinese Nuclear Waste Disposal Program.

 ...

Research Interests:
Cryosphere and global change.
 
Education:
September, 1992, B.S. in Structure Geology and Geophysics, Department of Earth Sciences, Nanjing University, China.
October, 1997, Ph.D. in Glaciology, Cold and Arid Regions Environmental and Engineering Research Institute, Chinese Academy of Sciences.
 
Experience:
 
October, 1997－July, 2009, assistant professor (1997), associate professor (2000), and professor (2003), successively in the Cold and Arid Regions Environmental and Engineering Research Institute, Chinese Academy of Sciences.
 
2002-2003, Post-doc in the Laboratoire des Sciences du Climat et de l'Environnement (LSCE), CEA/CNRS, France, and the Laboratoire de Glaciologie et Geophysique de l’Environnement (LGGE), CNRS, France.
 
Visiting Scholar to various oversea research units (i.e., Climate Change Research Center, University of New Hampshire, USA for 3-month in 1997 and 1999, respctively; Naval Postgraduate School, USA for 3-month in 2004; LGGE for 3-month in 2005, 1-month in 2008, 1-month in 2009, and 2-month in 2011, respectively; LSCE for 3-month in 2006 and 1-month in 2010, respectively; Climate Change Institute, University of Maine, USA for 1-month in 2006; Korea Polar Research Institute, Korea for 6-month in 2007).
 
32 expeditions to Antarctica, Alaska, Himalayas, Tibetan Plateau, Tienshan Mts, Altai Mts for a total period of >5 years.
 
PI of 7 fundings from the National Natural Scientific Foundation of China (including one of the most recognized fundings: the National Science Fund for Distinguished Young Scholars).
 
Committee member of the International Partnerships in Ice Core Sciences (IPICS).

Email:

Research Interests:
 
Tourism geography and tourism planning: tourism and place attachment, destination image, tourist satisfaction, tourist flow and tourist congestion monitoring. 
 
Natural and cultural heritages and landscape: Calligraphic landscape, soundscape and other multi-sensory scape, Outstanding Universal Value of Natural heritage and assessment
 
Karst geomorphology and biokarst
 
Aesthetics evaluation on  nature, landscape and calligraphy, as well as Cross-culture communication and national identity.
                            
Dr. Jie ZHANG, professor of geography and tourism, is acting as the Director of University Institute for Tourism Research, Nanjing University, China. Dr. Zhang has studied geomorphology and later transferred his interests into tourism and heritage research. Zhang was born in Wuxi, Jiangsu, China. He received his B. Sc and M. Sc in 1982, 1987 from Nanjing University. He was the joint-Ph.D. student in School of Geography, Oxford, U.K. in 1988-1989 by SBFS, and obtained doctoral degree from Nanjing University, China in 1990.
 
Zhang’s research interests include tourist and allied flows, regional impacts and tourism planning, Chinese cultural and art heritages, geomorphologic heritage and its evaluation, empiric aesthetics of calligraphic art, and tourism and the Internet, as well as cross-culture communication and national identity. 
 
Zhang is the author and co-author of more than 200 refereed papers published in scholarly journals or book chapters in the fields of geography and tourism either in Chinese and English, as well as in Japanese. According to Chinese academic searching website, CNKI (in 2014), the total number of citation of Zhang’s papers is more than 6000 times, and his H-index is 44and ranks 96-106 among all the academic authors in China. In 2014, Zhang was awarded by Chinese Geographical Society (CGS) as the National Outstanding Geographical Researcher, and the one of the winner of the Top Paper Contribution Author Award by Acta Geographica Sinica. Two of his paper was awarded as Most cited Paper Award by CGS. His research paper on calligraphic aesthetics and culture was awarded as various outstanding paper several times by national China Calligrapher’s Association, and still keep the top 1 position in the most cited author according to CNKI system.
 
Zhang’s finished research projects include five projects supported by the National Science Foundation of China, three by the National Ministry of Construction, one by the National Ministry of Education, four provincial tourism planning projects, and dozens of regional tourism master planning projects either invited by local governments or won by bidding, and also a research project supported by UESCO (2014) and a joint-research project supported by British Academy (2007). His last finished NSFC project was titled as “Calligraphy Landscapes in China: Processes of Geographical Differentiation and Sense of Place”. His newly approved NSFC project (2016-2019) is titled as “Natural soundscape: its type classification, spatial structure and resource evaluation model”.
 
Zhang’s awarded research projects include: Spatial connectivity of Chinese Internet (2nd Class Award of Outstanding Youth Geographical Paper, Geographic Society of China, 1997 ), Tourist Flow to Chinese National Park (Best China paper Awards by APTA, 1999), National Pilot Evaluation System for Historic Township (3rd Class Provincial Scientific Progress Awards of Jiangsu, 2007), National Pilot Guidelines for Conservation Planning of Historic Township and Village (3rd-Class Provincial Soft Science Awards), Town Planning projects with 2nd class Municipal Awards of Best Tourism Planning of Nanjing (2005), and three 1st Class Awards of the Outstanding Tourism Planning of Jiangsu Province, as well as many outstanding paper awards by various academic organizations. Zhang is also active in public service and popularization of geography and traditional Chinese culture. 
 
Zhang’s research and practice in art include traditional Chinese landscape painting, Chinese calligraphy (Seal script, Oracle inscription script, Standard script), Seal engraving, traditional poem and couplet, and music of traditional Chinese vertical flute.

5. Social activities, public service and popularization of geography and traditional Chinese culture
In recent years, Zhang took part in many important social activities and the popularization of the geography and traditional Chinese culture in mainland of China, Hong Kong, U.K United State of America and Japan.
1. Travel in Nanjing and the related historic geography. Civil Lecture of Nanjing Municipal Hall, and broadcasted in 10 episodes by Nanjing Broadcasting Radio Station:. June, 2014
2. In 2011 Zhang was invited by the central government of China as consultant experts member of the “Academician and Scientific experts Consulting Group organized by Central Government”, assigned to visit Shan’xi Province, and presented a consultant lecture on  Regional tourism planning for Yanan Municipal Government
3. Civil Lecture in Hall of the Nanjing Civil Library: Discovering the miracle of natural wonder of Jiuzhaigou, world heritage site. Jan, 2012 
4. Civil Lecture in Hall of the Nanjing Civil Library: Local cultural context and legend of Calligraphy in Nanjing City. Sept 2010
5. Calligraphic landscape and tourism in China. Invited Lecture in Bournemouth University, U.K.; May, 2007
6. Calligraphic landscape in China. Invited  Lecture University of South Carolina, Oct 2008。
7. Calligraphic landscape in China and Japan. Invited lecture in Rekyu (St. Paul’s) University, Tokyo, Mar, 2010
8. Natural heritage and tourism landscape in Huangshan. Consultant lecture to Local Authority and Management Committee of HuangsHan a World heritage site, Nov, 2012
9. Donated a self-compiled and written calligraphic couplet art works on behalf of Chinese Geographical Society to the local government of Kanas, Xinjiang Autonomous Region, Sept, 2013. The couplet is in seal script, and connotes of local place names and geographic knowledge with traditional style.
10. Donated a self-compiled and written calligraphic couplet art works on behalf of Chinese Geographical Society and UNESCO to the local government of Sanqinshan National Park, Jiangxi, a world heritagesite. The couplet is in seal script, and connotes of local place names and geographic knowledge with traditional style.(see Photo) 
 

 
6. ART PRACTICE AND RESEARCH
Zhang’s research and practice in art include traditional Chinese landscape painting, Chinese calligraphy (Seal script, Oracle inscription script, standard script), Seal engraving, traditional poem and couplet, and music of traditional Chinese vertical flute. Zhang is also acting as the executive head of the University Research Centre of Oriental Calligraphy and Painting, Nanjing University. He wrote poems in traditional Chinese poem style and published some on newspapers like People’s Daily (overseas edition) etc. Zhang reported a hole-fingering model in high pitch for Xiao (a traditional Chinese musical instrument, the bamboo vertical flute). Zhang has published many papers either in Chinese and English on aesthetics research on calligraphy, won several academic awards of outstanding calligraphic research paper from national Chinese Calligrapher’s Association. Zhang developed the evolutionary model of natural image and calligraphic aesthetic.
Table. Zhang’s artistic works of paintings, seal engraving.

title: School of Life Sciences
text:
Name: 
Prof. Shuqing AN


Title:
Professor


Affiliation:
School of Life Sciences
							


Email:
anshq@nju.edu.cn


Research Interests:
Focus on restoration and reconstruction of structure and function of vegetations, and 4 fields are included as the followings.
1、Wetland ecology and ecological engineering of wetland restoration: Tissue culture and mass propagation of plant tool species, wetland vegetation restoration, carbon/nitrogen/phosphorus/sulfur biogeochemical cycles in wetlands, treated wetland and constructed wetland, planning, design, environmental evaluation and of wetland reserves and parks, rehabilitation of wetland ecosystems.
2、Forest ecology and biodiversity conservation: Vegetation structure, dynamic changes, hydrological function, functional group restoration; loss and conservation of genetic diversity of rare, endangered and important species, trade-off between seeds and seedlings of tree species.
3、Conservation and reconstruction of freshwater forested wetland: Distribution pattern, reginal characteristics, mechanism of degradation and missing, identification of key dominant species, conservation, restoration and rehabilitation of freshwater forested wetlands.
4、Biological invasions in wetlands and global changes: Mechanism and management of Spartina alterniflora invasions, decline mechanism and population restoration of Spartina anglica, impact of Spartina invasions on circulation of key life-needed elements, trace gas release and global changes of Spartina saltmarshes.

text:
Prof. Shuping BI
Time:2015-09-08 11:21　Source:未知 Author:chenxiaoqing　
              Click: 

Prof.Bi’s main research interests are in the field of environmental analytical chemistry, bio-electrochemistry, particularly focusing on the interaction of toxic metal ions and nano-particulates with some important biological molecules including proteins and DNA. By applying various modern analytical methodologies including electrochemical, spectrometric, chromatographic, magnetic methods, as well as combining with computer simulations and quantum chemical calculations, the structure and mechanism of action of metallobiomolecules are studied comprehensively. Now, he is carrying out a new research work toward to establish the novel electrochemical methods to monitor and detect the free radicals generated in the biological and environmental chemistry processes in situ, in order to further deep understanding of the effect of metal ions and organic molecules on the electron transfer rate through DNA.

title: Prof. Zijian GUO_Section of Student Exchange Programmes Office of International Cooperation and Exchanges
text:
Prof. Zijian GUO
Time:2015-09-10 15:56　Source:未知 Author:chenxiaoqing　
              Click: 

 
His research work focuses on the following aspects: 
1) design of anticancer metal complexes with novel structural features and reactivities. Transitional metals such as platinum, 
palladium, nickel, copper and zinc are employed in these studies; 
2) conjugation of platinum drugs with selective targeting moieties or encapsulation of platinum drugs in host molecules or 
particles to achieve enhanced permeability and retention effect in tumour tissues. For example, bis-phosphonates, peptides, 
proteins and nanoparticles are commonly used in targeting and delivery studies; 
3) Development of a variety of fluorescent sensors which can be used for the detection of biologically essential metal ions, 
environmentally toxic heavy metals, inorganic drug species, DNA nucleases, and small signaling inorganic molecules.

Research fields include:
1) Analytical Biochemistry and Electroanalytical Chemistry:immunoassay, genetic detection, clinic detection techniques of tumor markers, voltammetric analysis, microdevices, lab-on-chip; fluorescent analysis, chemiluminescence, electrochemiluminescence, capillary electrophoresis, mass spectroscopy, bioconjugate chemistry;
2) Electrochemistry: mechanism of electrode process; self-assembled monolayers, bioelectrochemistry, microelectrodes and arrays, chemically modified electrodes, surface electrochemistry; applied electrochemistry;
3) Biosensors:biosensors, microbiosensors, immunosensors, cytosensors, multiplexed immunosensing; etc.
4) Nanotechnology: functional nanomaterials; molecularly imprinting; layer-by-layer assembly; nanocomposites; hybrid nanoparticles; nanocage; quantum dots; etc.

title: Prof. Xiaozhao LI_Section of Student Exchange Programmes Office of International Cooperation and Exchanges
text:
Prof. Xiaozhao LI
Time:2015-09-08 13:48　Source:未知 Author:chenxiaoqing　
              Click: 

Engineering geology, Geotechnical engineering, Urban underground space, Geothermal utilization, Nuclear waste disposal, Characterization of rock fracture system

 
Xiaozhao Li is a professor of geological engineering at the School of Earth Sciences and Engineering, Nanjing University, the Director of Institute for Underground Space and Geo-environment at Nanjing University (NJU-IUSG), director of Nanjing Innovation Centre for Shallow Geothermal Development Industry (ICSGI).
 
He received his BEng, MEng and PhD degrees from the State Key Discipline for Geotechnical Engineering at China University of Mining and Technology (CUMT). He was a Postdoctoral researcher in the State Key Discipline for Hydrogeology and Engineering Geology at Nanjing University (1996-1998), a Visiting Professor at Nanyang Technological University in Singapore (2005, 2015), a Guest Professor in Institute of Applied Earth Sciences at Graz University of Technology in Austria (2008) and a Invited Visiting Professor in Laboratory of Engineering and Environmental Geology at Swiss Federal Institute of Technology in Lausanne (2011).
 
His current research focuses on: 1) Urban underground sustainable development: impacts of underground engineering on geological environment, mechanism of interaction between developments of different urban underground resources (space, water, energy and material) and methodology of sustainable urban underground development (e.g. Energy Geostructure); 2)Characterization and modeling of fractures at different scales; 3)Radioactive waste disposal: site investigation and characterization, design principle and construction methods for depository & Underground Research Laboratory (URL), etc.
 
His researches have been granted by National Key Basic Research Program of China (973 Program), Chinese National Science Foundations, also inter-governmental and internatioanl JRP program, such as Sino-Swiss Science and Technology Cooperation (SSSTC) and EU-FP7-Marie Curie IRSES. He has won 8 national awards, including the first prize for scientific and technological progress awarded by China Education Ministry in 2001, National Award for Youth Scientist in Geology in 2001 and “New Century Excellent Talents in University” awarded by China Education Ministry in 2004.
 
He is the author of more than 150 papers, has gained the Second Prize for Excellent Textbooks in China. He has been invited to deliver more than 30 keynotes and plenary lectures in academic conferences, served on about 30 scientific committees in national and international conferences. He has been also invited to deliver 9 lectures in universities and research organizations. 
 
He is active members of many academic societies, such as Member of Working Group 15-Underground and Environment of the International Tunnelling and Underground Space Association (ITA-AITES), Core member of International Geotechnical Safety Network (GEOSNet), Vice chair of Chinese Society for Underground Space, Vice chair of Waste Underground Disposal Committee of CSRME (China Society for Rock Mechanics and Engineering), Vice chair of China Society for Underground Space, Vice chair of Youth Committee of CSRME, Vice chair of Tunnel and Underground Works Risk Control Committee of China Civil Engineering Society. He is on the editorial boards of Chinese Journal of Rock Mechanics and Engineering, Chinese Journal of Underground Space and Engineering and Journal of Basic Science and Engineering.
 
He has also been invited as evaluation experts by many agencies, such as such as National Natural Science Foundation of China (NSFC), China Ministry of Science and Technology (MOST), China Ministry of Education (MOE) and China Academic Degrees & Graduate Education Development Centre (CDGDC). He has participated advisory and consulting works for large-scale engineering projects in different counties, e.g. he was appointed the chair of review panel for the geotechnical investigation of Hong Kong-Zhuhai-Macau Oversea Channel(including bridges, subsea tunnels and artifical island) which calls for a total investment of over 72 billion RMB. He is one of the main experts invited by central government and stakeholders on Chinese Nuclear Waste Disposal Program.
