title: The Institute of Advanced Studies in Humanities and Social Studies_Section of Student Exchange Programmes Office of International Cooperation and Exchanges
text:
The Institute of Advanced Studies in Humanities and Social Studies
Time:2015-08-07 16:40　Source:未知 Author:hongyuxing　
              Click: 
               


The Institute of Advanced Studies in Humanities and Social Studies (IAS)
Founded in May 2005, the Institute of Advanced Studies in Humanities and Social Studies is the first advanced research institute for studies in humanities and social sciences in China mainland. With a vision to further build Nanjing University into an international comprehensive and research-intensive university, the Institute is meant as a special zone for advanced research in humanities and social sciences, to break disciplinary boundaries and encourage cross- disciplinary studies with a problem-solving approach. Research positions in the Institute include guest professorship, distinguished professorship and residential professorship. There are six prominent research teams focused on “Study on Extraterritorial Chinese Books”, “Environmental Studies,” “Media and Culture Studies,” “Gender Studies,” “City and Space Studies”, and “Construction of a Modern System of Knowledge: China and East Asia(CMSK)”. The Institute has also offered students successful series of lectures such as “Masters’ Forum”, “Academic Forefront” and “Theme Lectures” .
 
For more information, please visit: http://ias.nju.edu.cn/ .

title: The Johns Hopkins University-Nanjing University Center for Chinese and American Studies_Section of Student Exchange Programmes Office of International Cooperation and Exchanges
text:
The Johns Hopkins University-Nanjing University Center for Chinese and American Studies
Time:2015-08-07 16:19　Source:未知 Author:hongyuxing　
              Click: 
               


The Johns Hopkins University-Nanjing University Center for Chinese and American Studies (HNC)
The Hopkins-Nanjing Center is a joint program founded in 1986. In 2006, the center started to offer a joint master program fully credited both in China and the United States. Being the earliest-established joint venture in higher education since China’s reform, the center aims at developing young professionals and researchers in international and Sino -American relationships. Teaching and research at the center focus on issues in Chinese and American politics, social studies, economics, law, history and culture. The center has become a successful and exemplary practice in Sino-American cooperation of education. Former President George Bush and Secretary of State Henry Kissinger both visited the center.

At the celebration of the 20th Anniversary of the Center for Chinese and American Studies, Dr. Henry Kissinger addressed the audience.
 
 
For more information, please visit: http://hnc.nju.edu.cn/ .

Time:2015-08-07 16:07　Source:未知 Author:hongyuxing　
              Click: 
               


Yangtze River Delta Economics and Social Development Research Centre of Nanjing University 
Founded in February 2001,Yangtze River Delta Economics and Social Development Research Centre of Nanjing University is one of the key research centers commissioned by the Ministry of Education for studies in humanities and social sciences. The Director of the center is Chancellor Hong Yinxing. Research at the center is devoted to social and economic issues of the Yangtze River Delta. The center has successfully hosted 29 Jiangsu Development Forums in the past 15 years. Known as a top think-tank, the center is consulted by Jiangsu Provincial Committee of CPC and Jiangsu Provincial People’s Government.

The China Centre for Linguistic and Strategic Studies (CCLASS)
The China Centre for Linguistic and Strategic Studies (CCLASS) is a research centre based in Nanjing University, P. R. China and it was established on November 9th, 2007. CCLASS is jointly funded and managed by the Department of Language and Information Management, Ministry of Education (MOE), PRC and Nanjing University. Its objective is to encourage the interdisciplinary studies of language policies, language planning and language strategies...The China Centre for Linguistic and Strategic Studies (CCLASS) based in Nanjing University is jointly funded and managed by the Ministry of Education (MOE), PRC and Nanjing University. It is the first of its kind in China.
For more Information, please visit:  http://www.chinalanguage.net/index.asp?ac=web&id=143

Center for Research of Chinese New Literature of Nanjing University
Commissioned by Ministry of Education and established in 1999, Center for Research of Chinese New Literature of Nanjing University is one of the first key national research centers for studies in humanities and social sciences. Prof. Ding Fan serves as Director of the Center. Major research concentrations include: trends in modern and contemporary Chinese literature, rural literature in the 20th century China, schools and societies in modern Chinese literature, history of modern and contemporary Chinese drama, Taiwan and overseas Chinese literature, enlightenment and literature in the 20th century China, etc. The specialized museum at the center houses abundant materials of contemporary and modern Chinese literary works.

title: 出国留学 > 具体流程 > 报名手续_南京大学国际合作与交流处 学生交流科
text:
1. 请有意愿参加国际交流项目的同学密切关注国际处学生交流科网页的“通知通告”栏目，确保及时获取项目通知。
 
2. 学制。部分国外大学采用的学期为三学期制（如：加拿大、英国等），与我国稍有不同，但绝大部分国外大学的学制与我国的两学期制相似，分为春季学期和秋季学期（或称：第一学期和第二学期）。一般而言，2月（或：3月）至7月为一个学期，8月（或：9月）至12月为另一个学期。另，因南北半球地域属性，春季、秋季学期的称呼相异。
 
3. 交流生选拔条件如下：
（1）南京大学全日制本科生、全日制硕士研究生、全日制博士研究生；
（2）德、智、体全面发展，身心健康，有较强的生活适应能力和协调沟通能力，无不良生活习惯，在南大学习期间未受过任何纪律处分；
（3）各门课程成绩达到良好及以上，没有任何课程不及格的记录；
（4）有较强的外语水平和应用能力；
（5）每位本科生/研究生在校期间只能参加一次长期交流项目，研究生参加申报须征得院系导师的同意。
 
4. 交流生选拔程序如下：
（1）交流项目主要从本科2-3年级学生或研究生1-2年级学生中选拔。个别项目如对方学校有特殊要求，也可在本科4 年级或研究生3 年级中选拔；必须坚持信息公开、机会均等、自愿报名、择优选拔的原则；
（2）教务处和研究生院每年依据国际处提供的项目信息发布通知；
（3）本科生需由本人针对具体项目提出申请，征得所在院系同意并推荐后，参加教务处组织的交流生考试（主要为外语应用能力测试）或面试；研究生需由本人针对具体项目提出申请，征得导师、院系和研究生院培养办公室的同意，参加由研究生院组织的面试；有意向参加出国交流项目的同学在报名之前请提前报考相应的语言能力证书等（例如：雅思/托福），以备申请过程顺畅。
（4）教务处和研究生院依据相关的考试要求和交流项目的具体要求，拟定推荐的人员名单，并向国际处及时提供；
（5）国际处若对被推荐人员的外语能力或其他申请资质有异议，可与教务处或研究生院联合进行二次筛选。
 
5. 相关材料的准备。由于申请材料不会退还，部分材料（如：中英文成绩单，在读证明，银行存款证明等）建议一次办理多份，以备签证之需。
（1）护照。
（2）中英文成绩单。请先至本院系教务员处开具中文成绩单，将中文成绩单进行翻译。领取翻译件后，送至本校教务处或研究生院审核并盖章。
（3）在读证明。请登录国际处学生交流科网页下载中心，下载“在读证明模板”（在学生交流科网页首页的“下载中心”下载），填写个人信息并打印，经院系盖章后，送至教务处或研究生院审核盖章。
（4）体检报告。部分国外高校，尤其是日本高校，要求交流生提交体检报告。表格请在对方大学网站下载（国际处学生交流科网页“合作院校留学说明”栏目有对方大学网址）。携带表格到南京市出入境检疫检验局进行体检。
 

本科生校内申请流程：
 
（一）登陆“交换生管理系统”（http://desktop.nju.edu.cn:8080/exchangesystem/index），点击“交换项目”开始申请，根据要求认真填写信息并提交。 
（二）院系审核。
（三）院系审核通过后，登陆系统打印申请表（可先打印为PDF，再打印为纸质版），并在规定时间内递交至教务处。
（四）学校遴选并公布名单。
 
申请表递交时间及地点
 
2.仙林校区
时间：上午9:30-11:30，下午2:30-4:30
地点：仙林校区行政北楼（扬州楼）教学研究科办公室。
注：申请通过院系审核后，必须打印纸质的申请表并在上述规定时间内交至教务处，逾期不候，否则该申请将无法通过审核。
 
 注意事项
 
（一）有意向报名的同学，请登录对方学校主页查看具体院系专业设置和课程安排，尽可能选择相同或相近专业。
（二）请合理规划大学生涯与学习计划，确认赴外交换学分转换的可能性以及回校之后课程的衔接性，以避免因赴外交换而影响课业甚至毕业。 
（三）递交申请后请务必保持通讯畅通，及时查收邮件。
 
联 系 人：教务处老师
联系电话：89680375
电子邮箱：jwcexchange@nju.edu.cn
 
研究生校内申请流程：
 
一、学术学位研究生校内网申： 
登录学术学位研究生学籍与教学管理系统 http://pyb.nju.edu.cn/，点击“申报系统”— “国际交流”--“校际交流合作”，进行网上申请。
 
二、于研究生院规定日期之前提交材料： 
（1）国际交流项目推荐表（在国际处学生交流科网站首页的“下载中心”下载）
（2）个人简介 
（3）相关语言证明材料复印件
 
三、学术学位研究生申请材料提交地点及咨询电话：
1、鼓楼校区：南苑综合楼， 83592463
2、仙林校区：行政北楼902,  89682463
 
四、专业学位研究生请电话咨询：
仙林校区：行政北楼907，89686492
 
联 系 人：研究生院 邹老师或叶老师
电子邮箱：zdy@nju.edu.cn，pfye@nju.edu.cn
 

另外，对于各个学校的了解，请同学们仔细查看“合作院校留学说明”栏目（世界地图页），在这里你可以找到任何你想去的学校。
点击学校名称和website，你可以浏览该校的网页和国际交流网页；
点击fact sheet和other documents，你可以搜集到报名申请该校所需要的材料、表格等；
点击application，你可以转到该校的报名网页。

title: 出国留学 > 具体流程 > 申请程序_南京大学国际合作与交流处 学生交流科
text:
1. 学生获得本校推荐后，需在规定期限内向国际合作与交流处提交完整的外方申请材料。
 
2. 部分国外高校会要求学生在准备纸质材料的同时，完成外方学校的网上申请。
 
请同学们登录国际处学生交流科网页的“合作院校留学说明”栏目，点击大洲名——国家名，找到你要申请的学校，里面上载了该校的网页、留学说明（fact sheet）、和该学校的申请网页。这些信息可以帮你了解学校的相关情况。点击学校名称和website，你可以浏览该校的网页和国际交流网页；点击fact sheet和other documents，你可以搜集到报名申请该校所需要的材料、表格等；点击application，你可以转到该校的报名网页进行申报填写（对方学校一旦开通申请网页，即可以点击）。
 
3. 所需材料参考以下清单，实际以项目要求为准：
1） 校方提名信（由国际合作与交流处出具）
2） 外方网页显示的申请表
3） 最新中英文成绩单（原件、翻译件）
4） 在读证明
5） 经济能力证明表
6） 银行存款证明（父母或本人名下皆可；若在父母名下，请同时出具亲属关系证明或公证书）
7） 语言能力证明（如：托福、雅思，日语或其他语种的能力等级证书）
8） 外方高校选课单
9） 推荐信（建议由院系任课老师出具）
10） 本人自述
11） 学习计划
12） 护照复印件
13） 体检报告
14） 外方住宿申请表
15） 境外医疗保险
16） 接收大学要求缴纳的申请费或手续费
17） 其他
 

办理护照或签证会去以下地点：
南京市公安局出入境管理处：
地址：白下路173号
电话：025-84420254
 
办理公证书会去以下地点：
南京市公证处：
地址：长江路99号长江贸易大楼6楼、7楼
电话：025-84796666
南京市鼓楼公证处：
地址：中山北路178号4楼
电话：025-83608697
网址：http://www.glgzc.org/

 
4. 确保申请信息填写真实、完备；材料（纸质、电子）的提交请依据国际处学生交流科网页的通知要求。
 
5. 部分国外高校会在学生寄出申请、等待录取的过程中组织面试、笔试或者其他形式的考核。（国际处会在学生交流科网页发布通知，请随时密切关注）
 
6. 学生在等待录取的过程中，必须密切关注国际处学生交流科网页“通知通告栏”发布的通知、电话、电子邮箱或邮政信箱，以备随时获取录取动态。在整个申请、录取和交流期间，学生的联络方式若有更改，请以电话或电子邮件的方式，及时告知所在院系和国际处，以便及时处理项目应急情况。
 
 

交换生中英文成绩单、在读证明办理流程 
 
一、办理时间、地点
 
仙林校区：周一、周四：上午9:00-11:30接受申请，行政北楼410；
 
二、注意事项
 
1. 办理前一周内，进入教务网，确认课程和成绩；
2. 中、英文成绩单、在读证明由教务处直接打印；
3. 学分绩排名证明：根据模板打印，到所在院系教务员处签字（有模板）；
4. 其它由教务处颁发的各类证书、证明：需携带原件和翻译件（自行翻译）。
 
 
友情提醒：
 
1. 在读证明模板请到国际处学生交流科网页“下载中心”下载； 
2. 寒暑假期间，学校实行值班制度，请在学期内办理；
3. 大三升大四的学生，6月20日---9月20日停止办理中、英文成绩单
4. 教务处只办理英文成绩单，不办理其它语种成绩单；
5. 携带证书原件审核时最好附复印件一份，原件审核后即可带走。

title: 出国留学 > 具体流程 > 录取手续_南京大学国际合作与交流处 学生交流科
text:
当前位置：首页 > 出国留学 > 具体流程 > 录取手续 




1. 国际处会在收到对方大学邮寄过来的纸质录取通知书和相关材料后，第一时间在国际处学生交流科网页上发布通知通告，通知学生本人领取。在此期间，请务必关注学生交流科网页，并确保电话或电邮畅通。
 
2. 学生须在国际处学生交流科网页首页的“下载中心”下载并填写《出国人员审批表》（注意本科生和研究生的表格不同）。填写后，请附上录取通知书复印件，统一交至国际处出入境管理科（鼓楼校区树华楼107室）。
 
3. 学生须按对方大学的入学指南自行办理宿舍申请、保险费、签证申请、课程选择等事宜。
 
办理护照或签证会去以下地点：
南京市公安局出入境管理处：
地址：白下路173号
电话：025-84420254
 
办理公证书会去以下地点：
南京市公证处：
地址：长江路99号长江贸易大楼6楼、7楼
电话：025-84796666
南京市鼓楼公证处：
地址：中山北路178号4楼
电话：025-83608697
网址：http://www.glgzc.org/
 
4. 行前培训和国（境）外管理:
（1）交流生出国签证或出境证件办妥后，必须依照项目要求参加相关职能部门主办的行前培训。
（2）交流生到达对方学校后，应于两周内将国外或境外住址、联系方式及所选课程及时反馈给相关职能部门和所属院系学生管理办公室，并保持通畅的邮件联系；至少每个月一次向所在院系学生管理办公室汇报学习情况。交流生应及时与我驻外使领馆取得联系。

title: 特别项目 > 国家公派项目 > 项目介绍_南京大学国际合作与交流处 学生交流科
text:
·2015年国家留学基金资助出国留学人员选拔简章
http://www.csc.edu.cn/Chuguo/fc8d228ee3ec4374ae66c004ccb16e1f.shtml
·2015年申报指南  
http://www.csc.edu.cn/Chuguo/56fd44852e854cb1a4ff6f2294c498bd.shtml
·2015年留学项目专栏   
http://www.csc.edu.cn/Chuguo/4414bac35a2c4974b5f3bd0b02f900cf.shtml
 
1、中美富布莱特硕士生项目
 
2016-2017学年度中美富布赖特硕士生项目
应提交申请材料及要求
 
一、美方网上申请提交及上传要求
完整填写好网上申请表并在申请表相应页上传相关材料，包括:
1. Page 6, Resume/Curriculum Vitae(自选)。
2. Page 7 Transcript
（必须，包括（1）填好的课程评估体系说明（Information Concerning Foreign Student Academic Records）；（2）本科或硕士研究生（如有）的中英文成绩单）。
（本页上传顺序为：本科课程评估体系说明，本科中文成绩单，本科英文成绩单；（如已读硕士研究生，请继续按以下顺序上传）硕士研究生课程评估体系说明，硕士研究生中文成绩单，硕士研究生英文成绩单）
3. Page 11， Writing Sample (自选) 。
4. Page 12， Test Scores（如已有正式有效的托福或雅思成绩单）。
5. Page 13 ，Additional Information Page（必须，包括（1）本科及以上的中英文毕业证和学位证，或在读证明。）；（2）有效期至2017年12月及以后的护照照片页（如有））。
（已本科毕业的本页上传顺序为：本科中文毕业证，本科英文毕业证，本科中文学位证，本科英文学位证；（如已经研究生毕业，继续），研究生中文毕业证，研究生英文毕业证，研究生中文学位证，研究生英文学位证书；非网上提交的推荐信扫描件；护照照片页（如有））
（在读大学生本页上传顺序为：中英文在读证明；非网上提交的推荐信扫描件；护照照片页（如有））
填写完成网上英文申请书，以及所有上传工作之后，在网上点击“Submit”提交申请。
注意：
（1）、每页文件上传时只能作为一个文件上传，文件大小不能超过2MB。建议每次上传前，将所有文件按顺序先扫描成不超过2MB的PDF文件后再上传；
（2）本年度我们将继续实施电子材料评审，你上传的材料的准确和完整性对你的申请十分重要；
（3）在填好网上申请书后一定不要忘记点击“Submit”提交申请，否则你的申请书项目方将不会收到，由此会导致无法评审你的申请材料。
本年度申请阶段无需提交纸质材料。
 
二、推荐信要求
网上提交推荐信要求：所有推荐信，包括翻译件，必须通过网上申请系统提交。如果推荐人未能按要求在网上提交推荐信，推荐人或申请人本人需发电子邮件至Fulbright.MA.China@iie.org说明情况并咨询解决方案。
 
三、语言考试要求
目前，中美富布赖特MA项目不接受除托福考试或雅思学术类考试以外的任何其它考试的成绩单。上述考试的有效期为两年，所以2014年10月1日以前的考试成绩无效。凡未参加上述考试或无有效成绩的申请人需尽快报名参加其中之一的考试，考试日期不得晚于2015年7月15日。
我们在安置过程中已发现，一些美国学校只接受托福考试成绩，一些入选者虽然考了雅思，但最后也被要求考托福，请在选择考试类型时尽量考托福。
如在提交申请时还没有参加托福或雅思考试，请在申请表24项上填上不晚于2015年7月15日的考试日期，并在得到网上非正式成绩后将成绩发至Fulbright.MA.China@iie.org。晚于2015年7月15日参加托福或雅思考试，将失去被邀请参加面试的机会。
成绩要求：托福网考不低于95分；雅思（学术类）总成绩不低于6.5分，口语单项不低于5.5分。
另外，美国的MA项目一般需要GRE或GMAT考试成绩。本年度有效的GRE或GMAT考试是在2010年10月1日后参加的考试。如没有有效的成绩，又没有特殊情况，请尽快注册参加考试。
特别注意：请勿填写网上英文申请网站上的 “Report on Proficiency in English” 表格。该表格将在面试时由美国使馆官员填写。
 
四、面试时提交的材料（在申请者获得面试机会后,在面试报到时,申请者需提交以下材料一套。注:除明确需复印件外，其余均为原件）
1.  大学本科成绩单(Official Academic Transcripts）（中英文）
2.  TOEFL 或IELTS考试成绩单
3.  GRE或GMAT考试成绩单（如有）
4.  签字表（Signature Form）
 
五、注意事项
1、 未按要求准备的申请材料将不予受理
2、 未按规定时间提交的申请材料将不予受理

title: 特别项目 > 欧盟奖学金项目 > 项目介绍_南京大学国际合作与交流处 学生交流科
text:
Since 2010, Nanjing University participated in the LiSUM project funded by European Union, together with other 9 Chinese universities and 10 European universities. Since 2011, NJU joined EXPERTS, coordinated by the University of Goettingen. Continued in EXPERTS-II, EXPERTs-III, EXPERTS-Asia and EXPERTS-SUSTAIN. Till now, NJU is proud to be the partner university in EU-funded projects of Lotus, Lotus-II, Lotus-III, Lotus-Unlimited, Lotus+. By the end of Fall Semester 2014, NJU has sent out 35 faculty and students to Europe for short-term research stay or long-term exchange study.  
 
EXPERTS Project
EXPERTS I and its successors, EXPERTS II, EXPERTS III, EXPERTS4Asia, and EXPERTS - SUSTAIN, are scholarship projects funded by the European Commission targeted at citizens of Afghanistan, Bangladesh, Bhutan, China, India, Indonesia, the Maldives, Nepal, Pakistan, the Philippines, Sri Lanka and Thailand. The EXPERTS Partnership includes 7 European and 13 South and South-East Asian (SSEA) Higher Education Institutions (HEIs) from 12 Asian countries.
EXPERTS projects are coordinated by the University of Goettingen, Germany
Project Coordinator: Dr.Uwe Muuss
Email: experts@uni-goettingen.de
The projects provide scholarship opportunities for students and staff from South and South-East Asia to European partner universities. The EXPERTS4Asia project also has scholarships for EU students and staff to study and conduct research at the SSEA partner HEIs. The types of mobility which can be funded are:
Mobility of Undergraduate and Graduate students
Mobility of PhD students
Mobility of PostDocs
Mobility of Academic and Administrative Staff
One of the main goals of the EXPERTS Projects is to give continuity and sustainability to the successful multilateral collaboration created within all of the projects, including new players in the Erasmus Mundus programme. The consortiums are composed of 5 countries from group A (Afghanistan, Bhutan, Bangladesh, Nepal and Pakistan) and 7 countries from group B (China, India, Indonesia, the Maldives, Sri Lanka, the Philippines and Thailand). All together, the consortiums consist of 13 universities from SSEA and 7 universities from the EU, allowing the coverage of as many subject areas as possible.
The projects have multifaceted objectives: they aim on the one hand to focus on excellence in technical fields and on the other to strengthen mobility in a wide range of disciplines such as Agricultural and Environmental Studies; Engineering Technology; Health & Medical Studies; Social Development; Regional Development, Poverty & Growth; and Law. The projects further aim to address the specific country needs in the SSEA region whilst also considering the improvement of gender balance amongst the project's beneficiaries.
Numerous grants will be offered within the projects, from which roughly three quarters are for Asian nationals heading to the EU and roughly one quarter for EU nationals heading to Asia.
Of the 5 projects, EXPERTS - SUSTAIN (2014 - 2018) is the only one currently still offering scholarships for academic and professional mobilities both to Asia and Europe. All other scholarships for EXPERTS II (2011 - 2015), EXPERTS III (2012 - 2016) and EXPERTS4Asia (2013 - 2017) have now been distributed and the corresponding mobilities are either underway or in some cases have already been completed.
For more information, please visit: http://www.expertsasia.eu/index.asp?p=2247&a=2247
 
LOTUS Project
LOTUS I
There are no more calls for application in the framework of this project.
All scholarships have been granted. 
The Lotus I project started on the 15th of July 2010 and expired on the 14th of July 2014. 
A final report about this first Lotus I project will be sent to the European Commission on September 14th, 2014.
LOTUS II
There are no more calls for application in the framework of this project.
All scholarships have been granted.  
The Lotus II project will run from 15th July 2011 until 14th July 2015.
LOTUS III
There are no more calls for application in the framework of this project.
All scholarships have been granted.  
The Lotus III project will run from 15th July 2012 until 14th July 2016.
All three projects are financed by the European Commission.
 
LOTUS Unlimited is an Erasmus Mundus Action Two Partnership (EMA2) of European and South-East Asian Higher Education Institutions (HEI) and Associations aiming at fostering mutual enrichment and better understanding between the EU and South-East Asia (China, Vietnam, Cambodia, Myanmar, Indonesia, Thailand), through the exchange of persons, knowledge and skills at higher education level and to co-operate in the following program activities:
Mobility of undergraduate and graduate students
Mobility of PhD students
Post-doc mobility
Academic and administrative staff mobility
The types of mobility to be funded are: 
For students: undergraduate, master, doctorate and post-doctorate mobility opportunities
For academic staff: exchanges for the purposes of teaching, practical training and research
For more inforamation, please visit: http://www.lotus.ugent.be/index.asp?p=1361&a=1361
 
The LOTUS+ project offers scholarships for nationals of Cambodia, China, Indonesia, Myanmar, North Korea, Thailand and Vietnam to study or do research at one of our European partner universities.
The following types of scholarships will be available:
Bachelor exchanges (1-2 semesters) - open only for students from our Asian partners
Master exchanges (1-2 semesters) - open to all students from the seven partner countries
Master degrees (1-2 years) - open to all students from the seven partner countries
PhD exchanges (6-10 months) - open to all PhD´s from the seven partner countries
PhD degrees (36 months) - open to all master degree holders from the seven partner countries
Post-doc exchanges (6 - 10 months) - open to all nationals of the seven partner countries
Staff exchanges (1 month) - open to staff members at universities from the seven partner countries (priority given to partner universities)
Through the project it is also possible for all EU-nationals to apply for the following scholarships at the Asian partner universities.
Bachelor exchanges (1-2 semesters) - open only to students from our EU partners
Master exchanges (1-2 semesters) - open to all students from the EU countries
PhD exchanges (6-10 months) - open to all PhD´s from the EU countries
Post-doc exchanges (6 months) - open to all nationals of the EU countries
Staff exchanges (1 month) - open to staff members at all EU universities
The scholarships are open to all academic fields (except music, arts and language studies). There is no age limit to apply.
For more informaiton, please visit: http://www.lotusplus.eu/general_information

title: Admission > Study Opportunities at NJU > Chinese Language Training > Long term Chinese Program_Section of Student Exchange Programmes Office of International Cooperation and Exchanges
text:
Description 
This Chinese Language Training Program designed for overseas students is delivered by experienced teachers, focusing on Chinese Listening, Speaking, Reading, Writing and HSK Preparation. Students will be placed into classes of 8 different levels of beginner, elementary, intermediate and advanced according to their Chinese proficiency, with small-size class.
 
Length of Study 
6 months to 2 years, 20 hours a week, starting from beginner, elementary, intermediate and advanced.
 
Chinese Modules 
Intensive Chinese, Chinese Listening, Chinese Speaking, Chinese Reading, Chinese Writing, Chinese Culture
 
Optional Modules 
Chinese Calligraphy, Chinese Painting, Tai Ji, Ancient Chinese History, Modern Chinese History, Chinese Philosophy, Contemporary Chinese Economy, Chinese Poetry, Ancient Chinese, Contemporary Chinese Foreign Policy, etc
 
Cultural Activities 
Visits to historical scenes in and around Nanjing
 
Language Practices 
Communication with Chinese students, Chinese recitation & speech contest, teaching observation and practice, etc.
 
Application Date 
Application deadline: Dec. 30 for spring semester and June 30 for autumn semester. Recruitment terminates when seats are full. Applicant with relevant Chinese foundation may join a class in the middle of the course.
 
Entry Requirement 
Applicant should be over 18, with good health and valid foreign passport.
 
Fees 
Tuition fees: RMB9500/half year; RMB19000/year;
Application fees: RMB500/person.
Tuition fees should be paid after the enrolment.
Textbook fees will be collected according to the actual price.
 
Accommodation 
Xiyuan International Students’ Apartment, Nanjing University; or private off-campus accommodation (University’s Students’ Apartment should be booked in advance.)
 
Application Method 
An online application at www.studyinnju.com is sufficient. Applicants need not attach or mail any documents to us.
 
Recruitment Procedure 
1. Nanjing University will normally post “Letter of Admission of Overseas Students” and “Visa Application Form of Overseas Students (JW202)” to admitted applicant one month after receiving the application documents. Students can also log on to their accounts at www.studyinnju.com to check whether they are accepted or not .
2. Successful applicants could submit their visa application to Chinese Embassy or Consulate with Letter of Admission and JW202 Form.
3. Registration should be made according to time stated in Letter of admission at the Institute for International Students, Nanjing University. Original “Letter of Admission of Overseas Students”, “Foreigners’ Health Certificate” (valid only for 6 months, so applicants are recommended to take physical examination in April) and JW202 Form are required to bring when registering.
 
Course Date 
Course starts in February and September every year (subject to the date on Letter of Admission).

title: Admission > Study Opportunities at NJU > Degree-Programms Taught in Chinese > Master Program_Section of Student Exchange Programmes Office of International Cooperation and Exchanges
text:
Application and Enrollment Steps: 
 
Apply for admission at online application system: www.studyinnju.com.
 
After successfully applying and uploading required documents please post the materials below to the Institute for International Students, Nanjing University (210093, 514 Zeng Xianzi Building, No. 18 Jinyin Street, Nanjing China) in one week and inform us by email. 
 
1. Present Undergraduate degree certificate or education level certificate, undergraduate degree transcript (this year’s graduates can first give expected graduation certificate). These materials should be the original form or a notarized photocopy in English or Chinese. These materials will not be returned.
 
2. Two letters of recommendation from professors in your academic area of study.
 
3. Appropriate HSK certification photocopies. Applicants interested in the liberal arts or business schools must demonstrate proficiency of at least New HSK level 5; applicants interested in the science departments must demonstrate proficiency of at least New HSK level 4. *Malaysia, Singapore and other countries who use Chinese as the education language need not demonstrate HSK proficiency.
 
Nanjing University will select superior students based on applicant’s materials and that year’s available majors, generally before the end of June will post the “Admission Notice” and “Visa Application for Study in China” (JW 202 form).
 
Those accepted will receive an “Admission Notice” and JW202 form to go to the People’s Republic of China under an X (study) visa.
 
Accepted persons should bring “Admission Notice”, “Physical Examination Form” (the effective dates are within 6 months) and JW202 form, in accordance with the date on the “Admission Notice” to arrive at the Institute for International Students to enroll. Those unable to arrive within those dates will need to officially ask for leave.
 
Enrollment Time: 
March 1 to May 20.
School Start Time:
That fall, specific date will be in “Admission Notice”
 
Tuition (rmb, each year for each person) 
Liberal Arts: 23,000 rmb
Science and Business Schools: 27,000 rmb
Medicine: 46,000 rmb
 
Online Application Fee: 500 rmb

title: Admission > Study Opportunities at NJU > Special Programms > EU Scholarship Programmes_Section of Student Exchange Programmes Office of International Cooperation and Exchanges
text:
Since 2010, Nanjing University participated in the LiSUM project funded by European Union, together with other 9 Chinese universities and 10 European universities. Since 2011, NJU joined EXPERTS, coordinated by the University of Goettingen. Continued in EXPERTS-II, EXPERTs-III, EXPERTS-Asia and EXPERTS-SUSTAIN. Till now, NJU is proud to be the partner university in EU-funded projects of Lotus, Lotus-II, Lotus-III, Lotus-Unlimited, Lotus+. By the end of Fall Semester 2014, NJU has sent out 35 faculty and students to Europe for short-term research stay or long-term exchange study.  
 
EXPERTS Project
EXPERTS I and its successors, EXPERTS II, EXPERTS III, EXPERTS4Asia, and EXPERTS - SUSTAIN, are scholarship projects funded by the European Commission targeted at citizens of Afghanistan, Bangladesh, Bhutan, China, India, Indonesia, the Maldives, Nepal, Pakistan, the Philippines, Sri Lanka and Thailand. The EXPERTS Partnership includes 7 European and 13 South and South-East Asian (SSEA) Higher Education Institutions (HEIs) from 12 Asian countries.
EXPERTS projects are coordinated by the University of Goettingen, Germany
Project Coordinator: Dr.Uwe Muuss
Email: experts@uni-goettingen.de
 
 
The projects provide scholarship opportunities for students and staff from South and South-East Asia to European partner universities. The EXPERTS4Asia project also has scholarships for EU students and staff to study and conduct research at the SSEA partner HEIs. The types of mobility which can be funded are:
Mobility of Undergraduate and Graduate students
Mobility of PhD students
Mobility of PostDocs
Mobility of Academic and Administrative Staff
 
One of the main goals of the EXPERTS Projects is to give continuity and sustainability to the successful multilateral collaboration created within all of the projects, including new players in the Erasmus Mundus programme. The consortiums are composed of 5 countries from group A (Afghanistan, Bhutan, Bangladesh, Nepal and Pakistan) and 7 countries from group B (China, India, Indonesia, the Maldives, Sri Lanka, the Philippines and Thailand). All together, the consortiums consist of 13 universities from SSEA and 7 universities from the EU, allowing the coverage of as many subject areas as possible.
 
The projects have multifaceted objectives: they aim on the one hand to focus on excellence in technical fields and on the other to strengthen mobility in a wide range of disciplines such as Agricultural and Environmental Studies; Engineering Technology; Health & Medical Studies; Social Development; Regional Development, Poverty & Growth; and Law. The projects further aim to address the specific country needs in the SSEA region whilst also considering the improvement of gender balance amongst the project's beneficiaries.
 
Numerous grants will be offered within the projects, from which roughly three quarters are for Asian nationals heading to the EU and roughly one quarter for EU nationals heading to Asia.
Of the 5 projects, EXPERTS - SUSTAIN (2014 - 2018) is the only one currently still offering scholarships for academic and professional mobilities both to Asia and Europe. All other scholarships for EXPERTS II (2011 - 2015), EXPERTS III (2012 - 2016) and EXPERTS4Asia (2013 - 2017) have now been distributed and the corresponding mobilities are either underway or in some cases have already been completed.
For more information, please visit: http://www.expertsasia.eu/index.asp?p=2247&a=2247
 
LOTUS Project
LOTUS I
There are no more calls for application in the framework of this project.
All scholarships have been granted. 
The Lotus I project started on the 15th of July 2010 and expired on the 14th of July 2014. 
A final report about this first Lotus I project will be sent to the European Commission on September 14th, 2014.
 
LOTUS II
There are no more calls for application in the framework of this project.
All scholarships have been granted.  
The Lotus II project will run from 15th July 2011 until 14th July 2015.
 
LOTUS III
There are no more calls for application in the framework of this project.
All scholarships have been granted.  
The Lotus III project will run from 15th July 2012 until 14th July 2016.
All three projects are financed by the European Commission.
 
LOTUS Unlimited is an Erasmus Mundus Action Two Partnership (EMA2) of European and South-East Asian Higher Education Institutions (HEI) and Associations aiming at fostering mutual enrichment and better understanding between the EU and South-East Asia (China, Vietnam, Cambodia, Myanmar, Indonesia, Thailand), through the exchange of persons, knowledge and skills at higher education level and to co-operate in the following program activities:
Mobility of undergraduate and graduate students
Mobility of PhD students
Post-doc mobility
Academic and administrative staff mobility
The types of mobility to be funded are: 
For students: undergraduate, master, doctorate and post-doctorate mobility opportunities
For academic staff: exchanges for the purposes of teaching, practical training and research
For more inforamation, please visit: http://www.lotus.ugent.be/index.asp?p=1361&a=1361
 
The LOTUS+ project offers scholarships for nationals of Cambodia, China, Indonesia, Myanmar, North Korea, Thailand and Vietnam to study or do research at one of our European partner universities.
The following types of scholarships will be available:
Bachelor exchanges (1-2 semesters) - open only for students from our Asian partners
Master exchanges (1-2 semesters) - open to all students from the seven partner countries
Master degrees (1-2 years) - open to all students from the seven partner countries
PhD exchanges (6-10 months) - open to all PhD´s from the seven partner countries
PhD degrees (36 months) - open to all master degree holders from the seven partner countries
Post-doc exchanges (6 - 10 months) - open to all nationals of the seven partner countries
Staff exchanges (1 month) - open to staff members at universities from the seven partner countries (priority given to partner universities)
Through the project it is also possible for all EU-nationals to apply for the following scholarships at the Asian partner universities.
Bachelor exchanges (1-2 semesters) - open only to students from our EU partners
Master exchanges (1-2 semesters) - open to all students from the EU countries
PhD exchanges (6-10 months) - open to all PhD´s from the EU countries
Post-doc exchanges (6 months) - open to all nationals of the EU countries
Staff exchanges (1 month) - open to staff members at all EU universities
The scholarships are open to all academic fields (except music, arts and language studies). There is no age limit to apply.
For more informaiton, please visit: http://www.lotusplus.eu/general_information
